   535â†’## WebSocket Patterns
   536â†’
   537â†’### WebSocket Server
   538â†’
   539â†’```go
   540â†’import "github.com/gorilla/websocket"
   541â†’
   542â†’var upgrader = websocket.Upgrader{
   543â†’    ReadBufferSize:  1024,
   544â†’    WriteBufferSize: 1024,
   545â†’    CheckOrigin: func(r *http.Request) bool {
   546â†’        // Configure origin checking
   547â†’        return true
   548â†’    },
   549â†’}
   550â†’
   551â†’type WSHub struct {
   552â†’    clients    map[*WSClient]bool
   553â†’    broadcast  chan []byte
   554â†’    register   chan *WSClient
   555â†’    unregister chan *WSClient
   556â†’    mu         sync.RWMutex
   557â†’}
   558â†’
   559â†’type WSClient struct {
   560â†’    hub  *WSHub
   561â†’    conn *websocket.Conn
   562â†’    send chan []byte
   563â†’    subs map[string]bool // Subscriptions
   564â†’}
   565â†’
   566â†’func NewWSHub() *WSHub {
   567â†’    return &WSHub{
   568â†’        clients:    make(map[*WSClient]bool),
   569â†’        broadcast:  make(chan []byte),
   570â†’        register:   make(chan *WSClient),
   571â†’        unregister: make(chan *WSClient),
   572â†’    }
   573â†’}
   574â†’
   575â†’func (h *WSHub) Run() {
   576â†’    for {
   577â†’        select {
   578â†’        case client := <-h.register:
   579â†’            h.mu.Lock()
   580â†’            h.clients[client] = true
   581â†’            h.mu.Unlock()
   582â†’            
   583â†’        case client := <-h.unregister:
   584â†’            h.mu.Lock()
   585â†’            if _, ok := h.clients[client]; ok {
   586â†’                delete(h.clients, client)
   587â†’                close(client.send)
   588â†’            }
   589â†’            h.mu.Unlock()
   590â†’            
   591â†’        case message := <-h.broadcast:
   592â†’            h.mu.RLock()
   593â†’            for client := range h.clients {
   594â†’                select {
   595â†’                case client.send <- message:
   596â†’                default:
   597â†’                    // Client's send channel is full, close it
   598â†’                    close(client.send)
   599â†’                    delete(h.clients, client)
   600â†’                }
   601â†’            }
   602â†’            h.mu.RUnlock()
   603â†’        }
   604â†’    }
   605â†’}
   606â†’
   607â†’func (s *Server) handleWebSocket(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {
   608â†’    conn, err := upgrader.Upgrade(w, r, nil)
   609â†’    if err != nil {
   610â†’        log.Printf("WebSocket upgrade failed: %v", err)
   611â†’        return
   612â†’    }
   613â†’    
   614â†’    client := &WSClient{
   615â†’        hub:  s.wsHub,
   616â†’        conn: conn,
   617â†’        send: make(chan []byte, 256),
   618â†’        subs: make(map[string]bool),
   619â†’    }
   620â†’    
   621â†’    client.hub.register <- client
   622â†’    
   623â†’    go client.writePump()
   624â†’    go client.readPump()
   625â†’}
   626â†’```
   627â†’
   628â†’### WebSocket Message Protocol
   629â†’
   630â†’```go
   631â†’// Message types
   632â†’type WSMessage struct {
   633â†’    Type string          `json:"type"`
   634â†’    Data json.RawMessage `json:"data"`
   635â†’}
   636â†’
   637â†’// Subscription message
   638â†’type SubMessage struct {
   639â†’    Channel string   `json:"channel"`
   640â†’    Symbols []string `json:"symbols"`
   641â†’}
   642â†’
   643â†’// Market data message
   644â†’type MarketDataMessage struct {
   645â†’    Channel   string          `json:"channel"`
   646â†’    Symbol    string          `json:"symbol"`
   647â†’    Price     decimal.Decimal `json:"price"`
   648â†’    Volume    decimal.Decimal `json:"volume"`
   649â†’    Timestamp time.Time       `json:"timestamp"`
   650â†’}
   651â†’
   652â†’func (c *WSClient) readPump() {
   653â†’    defer func() {
   654â†’        c.hub.unregister <- c
   655â†’        c.conn.Close()
   656â†’    }()
   657â†’    
   658â†’    c.conn.SetReadDeadline(time.Now().Add(60 * time.Second))
   659â†’    c.conn.SetPongHandler(func(string) error {
   660â†’        c.conn.SetReadDeadline(time.Now().Add(60 * time.Second))
   661â†’        return nil
   662â†’    })
   663â†’    
   664â†’    for {
   665â†’        var msg WSMessage
   666â†’        err := c.conn.ReadJSON(&msg)
   667â†’        if err != nil {
   668â†’            break
   669â†’        }
   670â†’        
   671â†’        switch msg.Type {
   672â†’        case "subscribe":
   673â†’            var sub SubMessage
   674â†’            json.Unmarshal(msg.Data, &sub)
   675â†’            c.handleSubscribe(sub)
   676â†’            
   677â†’        case "unsubscribe":
   678â†’            var sub SubMessage
   679â†’            json.Unmarshal(msg.Data, &sub)
   680â†’            c.handleUnsubscribe(sub)
   681â†’            
   682â†’        case "ping":
   683â†’            c.send <- []byte(`{"type":"pong"}`)
   684â†’        }
   685â†’    }
   686â†’}
   687â†’
   688â†’func (c *WSClient) writePump() {
   689â†’    ticker := time.NewTicker(54 * time.Second)
   690â†’    defer func() {
   691â†’        ticker.Stop()
   692â†’        c.conn.Close()
   693â†’    }()
   694â†’    
   695â†’    for {
   696â†’        select {
   697â†’        case message, ok := <-c.send:
   698â†’            c.conn.SetWriteDeadline(time.Now().Add(10 * time.Second))
   699â†’            if !ok {
   700â†’                c.conn.WriteMessage(websocket.CloseMessage, []byte{})
   701â†’                return
   702â†’            }
   703â†’            
   704â†’            c.conn.WriteMessage(websocket.TextMessage, message)
   705â†’            
   706â†’        case <-ticker.C:
   707â†’            c.conn.SetWriteDeadline(time.Now().Add(10 * time.Second))
   708â†’            if err := c.conn.WriteMessage(websocket.PingMessage, nil); err != nil {
   709â†’                return
   710â†’            }
   711â†’        }
   712â†’    }
   713â†’}
   714â†’```
   715â†’
   716â†’## Authentication & Security
   717â†’
   718â†’### JWT Authentication
   719â†’
   720â†’```go
   721â†’import "github.com/golang-jwt/jwt/v5"
   722â†’
   723â†’type Claims struct {
   724â†’    UserID string `json:"user_id"`
   725â†’    Email  string `json:"email"`
   726â†’    jwt.RegisteredClaims
   727â†’}
   728â†’
   729â†’func (s *Server) generateToken(userID, email string) (string, error) {
   730â†’    claims := Claims{
   731â†’        UserID: userID,
   732â†’        Email:  email,
   733â†’        RegisteredClaims: jwt.RegisteredClaims{
   734â†’            ExpiresAt: jwt.NewNumericDate(time.Now().Add(24 * time.Hour)),
   735â†’            IssuedAt:  jwt.NewNumericDate(time.Now()),
   736â†’            NotBefore: jwt.NewNumericDate(time.Now()),
   737â†’        },
   738â†’    }
   739â†’    
   740â†’    token := jwt.NewWithClaims(jwt.SigningMethodHS256, claims)
   741â†’    return token.SignedString([]byte(s.jwtSecret))
   742â†’}
   743â†’
   744â†’func (s *Server) validateToken(tokenString string) (string, error) {
   745â†’    token, err := jwt.ParseWithClaims(tokenString, &Claims{}, func(token *jwt.Token) (interface{}, error) {
   746â†’        if _, ok := token.Method.(*jwt.SigningMethodHMAC); !ok {
   747â†’            return nil, fmt.Errorf("unexpected signing method")
   748â†’        }
   749â†’        return []byte(s.jwtSecret), nil
   750â†’    })
   751â†’    
   752â†’    if err != nil {
   753â†’        return "", err
   754â†’    }
   755â†’    
   756â†’    if claims, ok := token.Claims.(*Claims); ok && token.Valid {
   757â†’        return claims.UserID, nil
   758â†’    }
   759â†’    
   760â†’    return "", fmt.Errorf("invalid token")
   761â†’}
   762â†’```
   763â†’
   764â†’### API Key Authentication
   765â†’
   766â†’```go
   767â†’func (s *Server) apiKeyAuth(next http.Handler) http.Handler {
   768â†’    return http.HandlerFunc(func(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {
   769â†’        apiKey := r.Header.Get("X-API-Key")
   770â†’        if apiKey == "" {
   771â†’            s.respondError(w, http.StatusUnauthorized, "Missing API key")
   772â†’            return
   773â†’        }
   774â†’        
   775â†’        // Validate API key
   776â†’        user, err := s.db.GetUserByAPIKey(r.Context(), apiKey)
   777â†’        if err != nil {
   778â†’            s.respondError(w, http.StatusUnauthorized, "Invalid API key")
   779â†’            return
   780â†’        }
   781â†’        
   782â†’        // Check permissions
   783â†’        if !user.HasPermission(r.Method, r.URL.Path) {
   784â†’            s.respondError(w, http.StatusForbidden, "Insufficient permissions")
   785â†’            return
   786â†’        }
   787â†’        
   788â†’        ctx := context.WithValue(r.Context(), userIDKey, user.ID)
   789â†’        next.ServeHTTP(w, r.WithContext(ctx))
   790â†’    })
   791â†’}
   792â†’```
   793â†’
   794â†’## Rate Limiting
   795â†’
   796â†’### Token Bucket Rate Limiter
   797â†’
   798â†’```go
   799â†’import "golang.org/x/time/rate"
   800â†’
   801â†’type RateLimiter struct {
   802â†’    limiters map[string]*rate.Limiter
   803â†’    mu       sync.RWMutex
   804â†’    rate     int
   805â†’    burst    int
   806â†’}
   807â†’
   808â†’func NewRateLimiter(r, b int) *RateLimiter {
   809â†’    return &RateLimiter{
   810â†’        limiters: make(map[string]*rate.Limiter),
   811â†’        rate:     r,
   812â†’        burst:    b,
   813â†’    }
   814â†’}
   815â†’
   816â†’func (rl *RateLimiter) getLimiter(key string) *rate.Limiter {
   817â†’    rl.mu.RLock()
   818â†’    limiter, exists := rl.limiters[key]
   819â†’    rl.mu.RUnlock()
   820â†’    
   821â†’    if !exists {
   822â†’        rl.mu.Lock()
   823â†’        limiter = rate.NewLimiter(rate.Limit(rl.rate), rl.burst)
   824â†’        rl.limiters[key] = limiter
   825â†’        rl.mu.Unlock()
   826â†’    }
   827â†’    
   828â†’    return limiter
   829â†’}
   830â†’
   831â†’func (s *Server) rateLimit(next http.Handler) http.Handler {
   832â†’    limiter := NewRateLimiter(100, 10) // 100 req/s, burst of 10
   833â†’    
   834â†’    return http.HandlerFunc(func(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {
   835â†’        // Rate limit by IP or user ID
   836â†’        key := r.RemoteAddr
   837â†’        if userID, ok := getUserID(r.Context()); ok {
   838â†’            key = userID
   839â†’        }
   840â†’        
   841â†’        if !limiter.getLimiter(key).Allow() {
   842â†’            s.respondError(w, http.StatusTooManyRequests, "Rate limit exceeded")
   843â†’            return
   844â†’        }
   845â†’        
   846â†’        next.ServeHTTP(w, r)
   847â†’    })
   848â†’}
   849â†’```

   885â†’### API Versioning

   909â†’## Testing Patterns
   910â†’
   911â†’### API Integration Tests
   912â†’
   913â†’```go

   947â†’### Mock HTTP Client

   949â†’```go
   950â†’type MockHTTPClient struct {

  1010â†’
  1011â†’## Best Practices
  1012â†’
  1013â†’### 1. Use Context Everywhere
  1014â†’
  1015â†’```go
  1016â†’func (s *Server) handler(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {
  1017â†’    ctx := r.Context()
  1018â†’    
  1019â†’    // Pass context to all operations
  1020â†’    data, err := s.db.GetData(ctx)
  1021â†’    if err != nil {
  1022â†’        s.respondError(w, http.StatusInternalServerError, err.Error())
  1023â†’        return
  1024â†’    }
  1025â†’    
  1026â†’    s.respondJSON(w, http.StatusOK, data)
  1027â†’}
  1028â†’```
  1029â†’
  1030â†’### 2. Structured Logging
  1031â†’
  1032â†’```go
  1033â†’func (s *Server) logRequest(r *http.Request, status int, duration time.Duration) {
  1034â†’    log.WithFields(log.Fields{
  1035â†’        "method":     r.Method,
  1036â†’        "path":       r.URL.Path,
  1037â†’        "status":     status,
  1038â†’        "duration":   duration,
  1039â†’        "ip":         r.RemoteAddr,
  1040â†’        "user_agent": r.UserAgent(),
  1041â†’    }).Info("API request")
  1042â†’}
  1043â†’```
  1044â†’
  1045â†’### 3. Health Checks
  1046â†’
  1047â†’```go
  1048â†’func (s *Server) healthCheck(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {
  1049â†’    checks := map[string]string{
  1050â†’        "database": "healthy",
  1051â†’        "exchange": "healthy",
  1052â†’    }
  1053â†’    
  1054â†’    // Check database
  1055â†’    if err := s.db.Ping(r.Context()); err != nil {
  1056â†’        checks["database"] = "unhealthy"
  1057â†’    }
  1058â†’    
  1059â†’    // Check exchange connection
  1060â†’    if err := s.exchange.Ping(); err != nil {
  1061â†’        checks["exchange"] = "unhealthy"
  1062â†’    }
  1063â†’    
  1064â†’    status := http.StatusOK
  1065â†’    for _, check := range checks {
  1066â†’        if check != "healthy" {
  1067â†’            status = http.StatusServiceUnavailable
  1068â†’            break
  1069â†’        }
  1070â†’    }
  1071â†’    
  1072â†’    s.respondJSON(w, status, checks)
  1073â†’}
  1074â†’```
  1075â†’
  1076â†’### 4. Request Tracing
  1077â†’
  1078â†’```go
  1079â†’func (s *Server) traceMiddleware(next http.Handler) http.Handler {
  1080â†’    return http.HandlerFunc(func(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {
  1081â†’        traceID := r.Header.Get("X-Trace-ID")
  1082â†’        if traceID == "" {
  1083â†’            traceID = generateTraceID()
  1084â†’        }
  1085â†’        
  1086â†’        ctx := context.WithValue(r.Context(), "traceID", traceID)
  1087â†’        w.Header().Set("X-Trace-ID", traceID)
  1088â†’        
  1089â†’        next.ServeHTTP(w, r.WithContext(ctx))
  1090â†’    })
  1091â†’}
  1092â†’```
  1093â†’
  1094â†’## Summary
  1095â†’
  1096â†’1. **Use standard library** - With chi router for simplicity
  1097â†’2. **RESTful design** - Clear resource-based URLs
  1098â†’3. **Proper status codes** - Communicate intent clearly
  1099â†’4. **Middleware chain** - Auth, logging, rate limiting
  1100â†’5. **Context propagation** - Pass request context everywhere
  1101â†’6. **Structured errors** - Consistent error responses
  1102â†’7. **WebSocket for real-time** - Market data streaming
  1103â†’8. **Rate limiting** - Protect against abuse
  1104â†’9. **Health checks** - Monitor service health
  1105â†’10. **Comprehensive testing** - Unit and integration tests

1â†’# Decimal Patterns - shopspring/decimal for Financial Calculations
     2â†’
     3â†’## Overview
     4â†’
     5â†’Big Meanie uses shopspring/decimal for ALL numeric operations involving money, prices, quantities, and percentages. This ensures exact decimal arithmetic without floating-point rounding errors that could cost real money in trading operations.
     6â†’
     7â†’## Table of Contents
     8â†’1. [Core Principles](#core-principles)
     9â†’2. [Basic Operations](#basic-operations)
    10â†’3. [Trading-Specific Patterns](#trading-specific-patterns)
    11â†’4. [Common Gotchas](#common-gotchas)
    12â†’5. [Performance Considerations](#performance-considerations)
    13â†’6. [Best Practices](#best-practices)
    14â†’
    15â†’## Core Principles
    16â†’
    17â†’```go
    18â†’import "github.com/shopspring/decimal"
    19â†’
    20â†’// NEVER use float64 for financial calculations
    21â†’// BAD
    22â†’price := 100.123  // float64 - NEVER DO THIS
    23â†’total := price * 1.5
    24â†’
    25â†’// GOOD
    26â†’price := decimal.NewFromFloat(100.123)
    27â†’total := price.Mul(decimal.NewFromFloat(1.5))
    28â†’
    29â†’// BETTER - avoid float entirely
    30â†’price := decimal.RequireFromString("100.123")
    31â†’multiplier := decimal.RequireFromString("1.5")
    32â†’total := price.Mul(multiplier)
    33â†’```
    34â†’
    35â†’## Basic Operations
    36â†’
    37â†’### Creation and Initialization
    38â†’
    39â†’```go
    40â†’// From string (PREFERRED for literals)
    41â†’price := decimal.RequireFromString("123.456789")
    42â†’
    43â†’// From int
    44â†’quantity := decimal.NewFromInt(100)
    45â†’
    46â†’// From float (ONLY when interfacing with external APIs)
    47â†’// Always validate precision after conversion
    48â†’apiPrice := decimal.NewFromFloat(apiResponse.Price)
    49â†’if apiPrice.Exponent() < -8 {
    50â†’    // Handle precision loss
    51â†’}
    52â†’
    53â†’// Zero and common values
    54â†’zero := decimal.Zero
    55â†’one := decimal.NewFromInt(1)
    56â†’hundred := decimal.NewFromInt(100)
    57â†’```
    58â†’
    59â†’### Arithmetic Operations
    60â†’
    61â†’```go
    62â†’// All operations return new decimals (immutable)
    63â†’a := decimal.RequireFromString("100.50")
    64â†’b := decimal.RequireFromString("25.25")
    65â†’
    66â†’sum := a.Add(b)           // 125.75
    67â†’diff := a.Sub(b)          // 75.25
    68â†’product := a.Mul(b)       // 2537.625
    69â†’quotient := a.Div(b)      // 3.98...
    70â†’
    71â†’// Chaining operations
    72â†’total := price.Mul(quantity).Add(fee).Sub(discount)
    73â†’
    74â†’// Percentage calculations
    75â†’price := decimal.RequireFromString("100")
    76â†’taxRate := decimal.RequireFromString("0.08") // 8%
    77â†’tax := price.Mul(taxRate)
    78â†’totalWithTax := price.Add(tax)
    79â†’
    80â†’// Or as percentage
    81â†’pct := decimal.RequireFromString("8")
    82â†’tax = price.Mul(pct).Div(decimal.NewFromInt(100))
    83â†’```
    84â†’
    85â†’### Comparisons
    86â†’
    87â†’```go
    88â†’a := decimal.RequireFromString("100.01")
    89â†’b := decimal.RequireFromString("100.02")
    90â†’
    91â†’if a.Equal(b) {
    92â†’    // Exact equality
    93â†’}
    94â†’
    95â†’if a.LessThan(b) {
    96â†’    // a < b
    97â†’}
    98â†’
    99â†’if a.LessThanOrEqual(b) {
   100â†’    // a <= b
   101â†’}
   102â†’
   103â†’if a.GreaterThan(b) {
   104â†’    // a > b
   105â†’}
   106â†’
   107â†’if a.GreaterThanOrEqual(b) {
   108â†’    // a >= b
   109â†’}
   110â†’
   111â†’// Compare with zero
   112â†’if balance.IsPositive() {
   113â†’    // balance > 0
   114â†’}
   115â†’
   116â†’if balance.IsNegative() {
   117â†’    // balance < 0
   118â†’}
   119â†’
   120â†’if balance.IsZero() {
   121â†’    // balance == 0
   122â†’}
   123â†’
   124â†’// Sign check
   125â†’sign := amount.Sign() // Returns -1, 0, or 1
   126â†’```
   127â†’
   128â†’## Trading-Specific Patterns
   129â†’
   130â†’### Price and Quantity Handling
   131â†’
   132â†’```go
   133â†’type Order struct {
   134â†’    Price    decimal.Decimal
   135â†’    Quantity decimal.Decimal
   136â†’    Side     string
   137â†’}
   138â†’
   139â†’// Calculate order value
   140â†’func (o Order) Value() decimal.Decimal {
   141â†’    return o.Price.Mul(o.Quantity)
   142â†’}
   143â†’
   144â†’// Apply trading fees
   145â†’func (o Order) TotalWithFee(feeRate decimal.Decimal) decimal.Decimal {
   146â†’    value := o.Value()
   147â†’    fee := value.Mul(feeRate)
   148â†’    
   149â†’    if o.Side == "BUY" {
   150â†’        return value.Add(fee)
   151â†’    }
   152â†’    return value.Sub(fee)
   153â†’}
   154â†’
   155â†’// Price tick rounding
   156â†’func RoundToTick(price, tickSize decimal.Decimal) decimal.Decimal {
   157â†’    if tickSize.IsZero() {
   158â†’        return price
   159â†’    }
   160â†’    return price.Div(tickSize).Round(0).Mul(tickSize)
   161â†’}
   162â†’```
   163â†’
   164â†’### Portfolio Calculations
   165â†’
   166â†’```go
   167â†’type Position struct {
   168â†’    Symbol   string
   169â†’    Quantity decimal.Decimal
   170â†’    AvgPrice decimal.Decimal
   171â†’}
   172â†’
   173â†’// Calculate position value
   174â†’func (p Position) Value(currentPrice decimal.Decimal) decimal.Decimal {
   175â†’    return p.Quantity.Mul(currentPrice)
   176â†’}
   177â†’
   178â†’// Calculate P&L
   179â†’func (p Position) PnL(currentPrice decimal.Decimal) decimal.Decimal {
   180â†’    currentValue := p.Value(currentPrice)
   181â†’    costBasis := p.Quantity.Mul(p.AvgPrice)
   182â†’    return currentValue.Sub(costBasis)
   183â†’}
   184â†’
   185â†’// Calculate P&L percentage
   186â†’func (p Position) PnLPercent(currentPrice decimal.Decimal) decimal.Decimal {
   187â†’    if p.AvgPrice.IsZero() {
   188â†’        return decimal.Zero
   189â†’    }
   190â†’    
   191â†’    pnl := currentPrice.Sub(p.AvgPrice)
   192â†’    return pnl.Div(p.AvgPrice).Mul(decimal.NewFromInt(100))
   193â†’}
   194â†’
   195â†’// Portfolio totals
   196â†’func CalculatePortfolioValue(positions []Position, prices map[string]decimal.Decimal) decimal.Decimal {
   197â†’    total := decimal.Zero
   198â†’    
   199â†’    for _, pos := range positions {
   200â†’        if price, ok := prices[pos.Symbol]; ok {
   201â†’            total = total.Add(pos.Value(price))
   202â†’        }
   203â†’    }
   204â†’    
   205â†’    return total
   206â†’}
   207â†’```
   208â†’
   209â†’### Technical Indicators
   210â†’
   211â†’```go
   212â†’// Moving average with decimal precision
   213â†’func SMA(prices []decimal.Decimal, period int) decimal.Decimal {
   214â†’    if len(prices) < period {
   215â†’        return decimal.Zero
   216â†’    }
   217â†’    
   218â†’    sum := decimal.Zero
   219â†’    for i := len(prices) - period; i < len(prices); i++ {
   220â†’        sum = sum.Add(prices[i])
   221â†’    }
   222â†’    
   223â†’    return sum.Div(decimal.NewFromInt(int64(period)))
   224â†’}
   225â†’
   226â†’// RSI calculation
   227â†’func RSI(prices []decimal.Decimal, period int) decimal.Decimal {
   228â†’    if len(prices) < period+1 {
   229â†’        return decimal.Zero
   230â†’    }
   231â†’    
   232â†’    gains := decimal.Zero
   233â†’    losses := decimal.Zero
   234â†’    
   235â†’    for i := len(prices) - period; i < len(prices); i++ {
   236â†’        diff := prices[i].Sub(prices[i-1])
   237â†’        if diff.IsPositive() {
   238â†’            gains = gains.Add(diff)
   239â†’        } else {
   240â†’            losses = losses.Add(diff.Abs())
   241â†’        }
   242â†’    }
   243â†’    
   244â†’    avgGain := gains.Div(decimal.NewFromInt(int64(period)))
   245â†’    avgLoss := losses.Div(decimal.NewFromInt(int64(period)))
   246â†’    
   247â†’    if avgLoss.IsZero() {
   248â†’        return decimal.NewFromInt(100)
   249â†’    }
   250â†’    
   251â†’    rs := avgGain.Div(avgLoss)
   252â†’    rsi := decimal.NewFromInt(100).Sub(
   253â†’        decimal.NewFromInt(100).Div(
   254â†’            decimal.NewFromInt(1).Add(rs),
   255â†’        ),
   256â†’    )
   257â†’    
   258â†’    return rsi
   259â†’}
   260â†’```
   261â†’
   262â†’### Risk Management
   263â†’
   264â†’```go
   265â†’// Position sizing with Kelly Criterion
   266â†’func KellySize(winProb, winSize, lossSize decimal.Decimal) decimal.Decimal {
   267â†’    if lossSize.IsZero() {
   268â†’        return decimal.Zero
   269â†’    }
   270â†’    
   271â†’    // f = (p * b - q) / b
   272â†’    // where p = win probability, q = loss probability, b = win/loss ratio
   273â†’    q := decimal.NewFromInt(1).Sub(winProb)
   274â†’    b := winSize.Div(lossSize)
   275â†’    
   276â†’    numerator := winProb.Mul(b).Sub(q)
   277â†’    kelly := numerator.Div(b)
   278â†’    
   279â†’    // Never risk more than 25% (Kelly can suggest aggressive sizes)
   280â†’    maxSize := decimal.RequireFromString("0.25")
   281â†’    if kelly.GreaterThan(maxSize) {
   282â†’        return maxSize
   283â†’    }
   284â†’    
   285â†’    if kelly.IsNegative() {
   286â†’        return decimal.Zero
   287â†’    }
   288â†’    
   289â†’    return kelly
   290â†’}
   291â†’
   292â†’// Stop loss calculation
   293â†’func CalculateStopLoss(entry, riskPercent decimal.Decimal, side string) decimal.Decimal {
   294â†’    risk := entry.Mul(riskPercent).Div(decimal.NewFromInt(100))
   295â†’    
   296â†’    if side == "LONG" {
   297â†’        return entry.Sub(risk)
   298â†’    }
   299â†’    return entry.Add(risk) // SHORT position
   300â†’}
   301â†’
   302â†’// Position size from risk amount
   303â†’func PositionSizeFromRisk(riskAmount, entry, stopLoss decimal.Decimal) decimal.Decimal {
   304â†’    riskPerUnit := entry.Sub(stopLoss).Abs()
   305â†’    if riskPerUnit.IsZero() {
   306â†’        return decimal.Zero
   307â†’    }
   308â†’    
   309â†’    return riskAmount.Div(riskPerUnit)
   310â†’}
   311â†’```
   312â†’
   313â†’## Common Gotchas
   314â†’
   315â†’### 1. Division by Zero
   316â†’
   317â†’```go
   318â†’// ALWAYS check for zero before division
   319â†’func SafeDivide(a, b decimal.Decimal) decimal.Decimal {
   320â†’    if b.IsZero() {
   321â†’        return decimal.Zero // or handle error appropriately
   322â†’    }
   323â†’    return a.Div(b)
   324â†’}
   325â†’
   326â†’// In ratio calculations
   327â†’func PriceToEarnings(price, earnings decimal.Decimal) decimal.Decimal {
   328â†’    if earnings.IsZero() || earnings.IsNegative() {
   329â†’        return decimal.NewFromInt(-1) // Indicate N/A
   330â†’    }
   331â†’    return price.Div(earnings)
   332â†’}
   333â†’```
   334â†’
   335â†’### 2. Precision and Rounding
   336â†’
   337â†’```go
   338â†’// Round to specific decimal places
   339â†’price := decimal.RequireFromString("123.456789")
   340â†’rounded := price.Round(2) // 123.46
   341â†’
   342â†’// Round for display vs calculation
   343â†’type Price struct {
   344â†’    value decimal.Decimal
   345â†’}
   346â†’
   347â†’func (p Price) Display() string {
   348â†’    // Round to 2 places for display
   349â†’    return p.value.Round(2).String()
   350â†’}
   351â†’
   352â†’func (p Price) Calculate() decimal.Decimal {
   353â†’    // Keep full precision for calculations
   354â†’    return p.value
   355â†’}
   356â†’
   357â†’// Exchange-specific precision
   358â†’func FormatForExchange(price decimal.Decimal, exchange string) string {
   359â†’    precisions := map[string]int32{
   360â†’        "binance":  8,
   361â†’        "coinbase": 2,
   362â†’        "kraken":   5,
   363â†’    }
   364â†’    
   365â†’    precision := precisions[exchange]
   366â†’    return price.Round(precision).String()
   367â†’}
   368â†’```
   369â†’
   370â†’### 3. String Conversion Errors
   371â†’
   372â†’```go
   373â†’// Always handle string parsing errors
   374â†’func ParsePrice(s string) (decimal.Decimal, error) {
   375â†’    price, err := decimal.NewFromString(s)
   376â†’    if err != nil {
   377â†’        return decimal.Zero, fmt.Errorf("invalid price format: %w", err)
   378â†’    }
   379â†’    
   380â†’    // Validate reasonable bounds
   381â†’    maxPrice := decimal.NewFromInt(1000000)
   382â†’    if price.IsNegative() || price.GreaterThan(maxPrice) {
   383â†’        return decimal.Zero, fmt.Errorf("price out of bounds: %s", s)
   384â†’    }
   385â†’    
   386â†’    return price, nil
   387â†’}
   388â†’
   389â†’// Use RequireFromString only with hardcoded values
   390â†’const FeeRate = "0.001" // 0.1%
   391â†’var TradingFee = decimal.RequireFromString(FeeRate)
   392â†’```
   393â†’
   394â†’### 4. JSON Marshaling
   395â†’
   396â†’```go
   397â†’// Decimal fields in JSON
   398â†’type Trade struct {
   399â†’    ID       string          `json:"id"`
   400â†’    Price    decimal.Decimal `json:"price"`
   401â†’    Quantity decimal.Decimal `json:"quantity"`
   402â†’    Total    decimal.Decimal `json:"total"`
   403â†’}
   404â†’
   405â†’// Custom JSON handling if needed
   406â†’func (t Trade) MarshalJSON() ([]byte, error) {
   407â†’    type Alias Trade
   408â†’    return json.Marshal(&struct {
   409â†’        Price    string `json:"price"`
   410â†’        Quantity string `json:"quantity"`
   411â†’        Total    string `json:"total"`
   412â†’        *Alias
   413â†’    }{
   414â†’        Price:    t.Price.String(),
   415â†’        Quantity: t.Quantity.String(),
   416â†’        Total:    t.Total.String(),
   417â†’        Alias:    (*Alias)(&t),
   418â†’    })
   419â†’}
   420â†’```

   422â†’### 5. Database Storage

   426â†’CREATE TABLE trades (

   449â†’## Performance Considerations
   450â†’
   451â†’### Memory Allocation
   452â†’
   453â†’```go
   454â†’// Reuse decimal values when possible
   455â†’var (
   456â†’    // Common constants
   457â†’    Zero     = decimal.Zero
   458â†’    One      = decimal.NewFromInt(1)
   459â†’    Hundred  = decimal.NewFromInt(100)
   460â†’    Thousand = decimal.NewFromInt(1000)
   461â†’)
   462â†’
   463â†’// Avoid creating new decimals in hot paths
   464â†’type Calculator struct {
   465â†’    // Pre-allocated decimals
   466â†’    hundred  decimal.Decimal
   467â†’    feeRate  decimal.Decimal
   468â†’    tickSize decimal.Decimal
   469â†’}
   470â†’
   471â†’func NewCalculator() *Calculator {
   472â†’    return &Calculator{
   473â†’        hundred:  decimal.NewFromInt(100),
   474â†’        feeRate:  decimal.RequireFromString("0.001"),
   475â†’        tickSize: decimal.RequireFromString("0.01"),
   476â†’    }
   477â†’}
   478â†’```
   479â†’
   480â†’### Batch Operations
   481â†’
   482â†’```go
   483â†’// Process multiple calculations efficiently
   484â†’func CalculateTotals(trades []Trade) decimal.Decimal {
   485â†’    total := decimal.Zero
   486â†’    
   487â†’    // Single allocation for all iterations
   488â†’    for i := range trades {
   489â†’        total = total.Add(trades[i].Price.Mul(trades[i].Quantity))
   490â†’    }
   491â†’    
   492â†’    return total
   493â†’}
   494â†’
   495â†’// Parallel processing for large datasets
   496â†’func ParallelSum(values []decimal.Decimal) decimal.Decimal {
   497â†’    if len(values) < 1000 {
   498â†’        // Serial for small datasets
   499â†’        sum := decimal.Zero
   500â†’        for _, v := range values {
   501â†’            sum = sum.Add(v)
   502â†’        }
   503â†’        return sum
   504â†’    }
   505â†’    
   506â†’    // Parallel for large datasets
   507â†’    numWorkers := runtime.NumCPU()
   508â†’    chunkSize := len(values) / numWorkers
   509â†’    results := make(chan decimal.Decimal, numWorkers)
   510â†’    
   511â†’    for i := 0; i < numWorkers; i++ {
   512â†’        start := i * chunkSize
   513â†’        end := start + chunkSize
   514â†’        if i == numWorkers-1 {
   515â†’            end = len(values)
   516â†’        }
   517â†’        
   518â†’        go func(chunk []decimal.Decimal) {
   519â†’            sum := decimal.Zero
   520â†’            for _, v := range chunk {
   521â†’                sum = sum.Add(v)
   522â†’            }
   523â†’            results <- sum
   524â†’        }(values[start:end])
   525â†’    }
   526â†’    
   527â†’    total := decimal.Zero
   528â†’    for i := 0; i < numWorkers; i++ {
   529â†’        total = total.Add(<-results)
   530â†’    }
   531â†’    
   532â†’    return total
   533â†’}
   534â†’```
   535â†’
   536â†’## Best Practices
   537â†’
   538â†’### 1. Type Safety
   539â†’
   540â†’```go
   541â†’// Create domain types for different decimal uses
   542â†’type Price decimal.Decimal
   543â†’type Quantity decimal.Decimal
   544â†’type Percentage decimal.Decimal
   545â†’
   546â†’func (p Price) Mul(q Quantity) decimal.Decimal {
   547â†’    return decimal.Decimal(p).Mul(decimal.Decimal(q))
   548â†’}
   549â†’
   550â†’// This prevents mixing incompatible types
   551â†’// price.Mul(percentage) // Compile error!
   552â†’```
   553â†’
   554â†’### 2. Validation
   555â†’
   556â†’```go
   557â†’func ValidateOrderParams(price, quantity decimal.Decimal) error {
   558â†’    if price.IsNegative() || price.IsZero() {
   559â†’        return fmt.Errorf("invalid price: %s", price)
   560â†’    }
   561â†’    
   562â†’    if quantity.IsNegative() || quantity.IsZero() {
   563â†’        return fmt.Errorf("invalid quantity: %s", quantity)
   564â†’    }
   565â†’    
   566â†’    minNotional := decimal.NewFromInt(10)
   567â†’    if price.Mul(quantity).LessThan(minNotional) {
   568â†’        return fmt.Errorf("order value below minimum: %s", price.Mul(quantity))
   569â†’    }
   570â†’    
   571â†’    return nil
   572â†’}
   573â†’```
   574â†’
   575â†’### 3. Constants
   576â†’
   577â†’```go
   578â†’// Define reusable constants
   579â†’var (
   580â†’    BasisPoint = decimal.RequireFromString("0.0001")  // 0.01%
   581â†’    Percentage = decimal.RequireFromString("0.01")    // 1%
   582â†’    
   583â†’    MaxLeverage = decimal.NewFromInt(10)
   584â†’    MinOrderSize = decimal.RequireFromString("0.001")
   585â†’    
   586â†’    MakerFee = decimal.RequireFromString("0.001")     // 0.1%
   587â†’    TakerFee = decimal.RequireFromString("0.0015")    // 0.15%
   588â†’)
   589â†’```
   590â†’
   591â†’### 4. Error Handling
   592â†’
   593â†’```go
   594â†’// Always validate external inputs
   595â†’func ProcessTradeRequest(req TradeRequest) error {
   596â†’    price, err := decimal.NewFromString(req.Price)
   597â†’    if err != nil {
   598â†’        return fmt.Errorf("invalid price: %w", err)
   599â†’    }
   600â†’    
   601â†’    quantity, err := decimal.NewFromString(req.Quantity)
   602â†’    if err != nil {
   603â†’        return fmt.Errorf("invalid quantity: %w", err)
   604â†’    }
   605â†’    
   606â†’    // Validate business rules
   607â†’    if err := ValidateOrderParams(price, quantity); err != nil {
   608â†’        return err
   609â†’    }
   610â†’    
   611â†’    // Process trade...
   612â†’    return nil
   613â†’}
   614â†’```
   615â†’
   616â†’### 5. Testing
   617â†’
   618â†’```go
   619â†’func TestPriceCalculation(t *testing.T) {
   620â†’    tests := []struct {
   621â†’        name     string
   622â†’        price    string
   623â†’        quantity string
   624â†’        expected string
   625â†’    }{
   626â†’        {
   627â†’            name:     "simple multiplication",
   628â†’            price:    "100.50",
   629â†’            quantity: "2.5",
   630â†’            expected: "251.25",
   631â†’        },
   632â†’        {
   633â†’            name:     "precision handling",
   634â†’            price:    "0.00000001",
   635â†’            quantity: "100000000",
   636â†’            expected: "1",
   637â†’        },
   638â†’    }
   639â†’    
   640â†’    for _, tt := range tests {
   641â†’        t.Run(tt.name, func(t *testing.T) {
   642â†’            price := decimal.RequireFromString(tt.price)
   643â†’            quantity := decimal.RequireFromString(tt.quantity)
   644â†’            expected := decimal.RequireFromString(tt.expected)
   645â†’            
   646â†’            result := price.Mul(quantity)
   647â†’            
   648â†’            if !result.Equal(expected) {
   649â†’                t.Errorf("got %s, want %s", result, expected)
   650â†’            }
   651â†’        })
   652â†’    }
   653â†’}
   654â†’```
   655â†’
   656â†’## Summary
   657â†’
   658â†’1. **Always use decimal for money** - Never float64
   659â†’2. **Parse from strings** - Avoid NewFromFloat when possible
   660â†’3. **Check for zero** - Before division operations
   661â†’4. **Validate inputs** - Especially from external sources
   662â†’5. **Define constants** - For commonly used values
   663â†’6. **Round appropriately** - Different precision for display vs calculation
   664â†’7. **Handle errors** - String parsing can fail
   665â†’8. **Test thoroughly** - Include edge cases and precision tests
   666â†’9. **Use domain types** - Price, Quantity, Percentage for type safety
   667â†’10. **Profile if needed** - Decimal ops are slower than float, optimize hot paths

    15â†’## Package Design
    16â†’
    17â†’### Package Structure
    18â†’```go
    19â†’// Package naming conventions
    20â†’package user        // Good: singular, lowercase
    21â†’package users       // Bad: plural
    22â†’package userMgmt    // Bad: camelCase
    23â†’package user_mgmt   // Bad: underscore
    24â†’
    25â†’// Package organization
    26â†’myproject/
    27â†’â”œâ”€â”€ cmd/
    28â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ api/
    29â†’â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ main.go
    30â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ worker/
    31â†’â”‚       â””â”€â”€ main.go
    32â†’â”œâ”€â”€ internal/
    33â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auth/
    34â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ database/
    35â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ models/
    36â†’â”œâ”€â”€ pkg/
    37â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ client/
    38â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ utils/
    39â†’â”œâ”€â”€ api/
    40â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ v1/
    41â†’â”œâ”€â”€ docs/
    42â†’â”œâ”€â”€ scripts/
    43â†’â”œâ”€â”€ go.mod
    44â†’â””â”€â”€ go.sum
    45â†’
    46â†’// Package declaration with documentation
    47â†’// Package user provides user management functionality.
    48â†’// It includes user creation, authentication, and profile management.
    49â†’package user
    50â†’
    51â†’// Import grouping
    52â†’import (
    53â†’    // Standard library
    54â†’    "context"
    55â†’    "fmt"
    56â†’    "time"
    57â†’    
    58â†’    // Third-party packages
    59â†’    "github.com/google/uuid"
    60â†’    "golang.org/x/crypto/bcrypt"
    61â†’    
    62â†’    // Internal packages
    63â†’    "myproject/internal/database"
    64â†’    "myproject/pkg/errors"
    65â†’)
    66â†’```
    67â†’
    68â†’### Package Cohesion
    69â†’```go
    70â†’// High cohesion - related functionality
    71â†’package auth
    72â†’
    73â†’type Authenticator interface {
    74â†’    Authenticate(credentials Credentials) (*User, error)
    75â†’    Refresh(token string) (*Token, error)
    76â†’    Revoke(token string) error
    77â†’}
    78â†’
    79â†’type Credentials struct {
    80â†’    Username string
    81â†’    Password string
    82â†’}
    83â†’
    84â†’type Token struct {
    85â†’    AccessToken  string
    86â†’    RefreshToken string
    87â†’    ExpiresAt    time.Time
    88â†’}
    89â†’
    90â†’type User struct {
    91â†’    ID       string
    92â†’    Username string
    93â†’    Roles    []string
    94â†’}
    95â†’
    96â†’// Low cohesion - avoid generic packages
    97â†’package utils  // Bad: too generic
    98â†’
    99â†’func HashPassword(password string) string { }
   100â†’func SendEmail(to, subject, body string) error { }
   101â†’func ParseJSON(data []byte) (interface{}, error) { }
   102â†’func GenerateID() string { }
   103â†’
   104â†’// Better: specific packages
   105â†’package password
   106â†’package email
   107â†’package json
   108â†’package id
   109â†’```
   110â†’
   111â†’### Package Dependencies
   112â†’```go
   113â†’// Minimize dependencies
   114â†’package user
   115â†’
   116â†’// Good: depends only on necessary packages
   117â†’import (
   118â†’    "context"
   119â†’    "myproject/internal/database"
   120â†’)
   121â†’
   122â†’// Bad: too many dependencies
   123â†’import (
   124â†’    "myproject/internal/auth"
   125â†’    "myproject/internal/email"
   126â†’    "myproject/internal/sms"
   127â†’    "myproject/internal/push"
   128â†’    "myproject/internal/analytics"
   129â†’    // ... many more
   130â†’)
   131â†’
   132â†’// Dependency inversion
   133â†’package service
   134â†’
   135â†’// Define interface in the consumer package
   136â†’type UserRepository interface {
   137â†’    GetUser(ctx context.Context, id string) (*User, error)
   138â†’    SaveUser(ctx context.Context, user *User) error
   139â†’}
   140â†’
   141â†’type UserService struct {
   142â†’    repo UserRepository  // Depend on interface
   143â†’}
   144â†’
   145â†’// Implementation in another package
   146â†’package database
   147â†’
   148â†’type PostgresUserRepository struct {
   149â†’    db *sql.DB
   150â†’}
   151â†’
   152â†’func (r *PostgresUserRepository) GetUser(ctx context.Context, id string) (*User, error) {
   153â†’    // Implementation
   154â†’}
   155â†’
   156â†’// Avoid circular dependencies
   157â†’package a
   158â†’import "b"  // a depends on b
   159â†’
   160â†’package b
   161â†’import "a"  // b depends on a - CIRCULAR!
   162â†’
   163â†’// Solution: introduce interface or third package
   164â†’package c
   165â†’type SharedInterface interface { }
   166â†’
   167â†’package a
   168â†’import "c"
   169â†’
   170â†’package b
   171â†’import "c"
   172â†’```
   173â†’
   174â†’## API Design
   175â†’
   176â†’### Exported vs Unexported
   177â†’```go
   178â†’package mypackage
   179â†’
   180â†’// Exported (public) - capitalized
   181â†’type Client struct {
   182â†’    Endpoint string
   183â†’    Timeout  time.Duration
   184â†’}
   185â†’
   186â†’func NewClient(endpoint string) *Client {
   187â†’    return &Client{
   188â†’        Endpoint: endpoint,
   189â†’        Timeout:  30 * time.Second,
   190â†’    }
   191â†’}
   192â†’
   193â†’func (c *Client) Request(ctx context.Context, data []byte) (*Response, error) {
   194â†’    return c.doRequest(ctx, data)
   195â†’}
   196â†’
   197â†’// Unexported (private) - lowercase
   198â†’type config struct {
   199â†’    retryCount int
   200â†’    backoff    time.Duration
   201â†’}
   202â†’
   203â†’func (c *Client) doRequest(ctx context.Context, data []byte) (*Response, error) {
   204â†’    // Internal implementation
   205â†’}
   206â†’
   207â†’// Partially exported struct
   208â†’type Response struct {
   209â†’    Status  int         // Exported
   210â†’    Data    []byte      // Exported
   211â†’    headers http.Header // Unexported
   212â†’}
   213â†’```
   214â†’
   215â†’### API Stability
   216â†’```go
   217â†’// Stable API design
   218â†’package stable
   219â†’
   220â†’// Use interfaces for flexibility
   221â†’type Store interface {
   222â†’    Get(key string) ([]byte, error)
   223â†’    Set(key string, value []byte) error
   224â†’    Delete(key string) error
   225â†’}
   226â†’
   227â†’// Options pattern for extensibility
   228â†’type ClientOptions struct {
   229â†’    Timeout     time.Duration
   230â†’    MaxRetries  int
   231â†’    Headers     map[string]string
   232â†’    // Can add new fields without breaking
   233â†’}
   234â†’
   235â†’func NewClient(opts ClientOptions) *Client {
   236â†’    // Set defaults for zero values
   237â†’    if opts.Timeout == 0 {
   238â†’        opts.Timeout = 30 * time.Second
   239â†’    }
   240â†’    if opts.MaxRetries == 0 {
   241â†’        opts.MaxRetries = 3
   242â†’    }
   243â†’    
   244â†’    return &Client{opts: opts}
   245â†’}
   246â†’
   247â†’// Functional options for better API
   248â†’type Option func(*Client)
   249â†’
   250â†’func WithTimeout(d time.Duration) Option {
   251â†’    return func(c *Client) {
   252â†’        c.timeout = d
   253â†’    }
   254â†’}
   255â†’
   256â†’func WithRetries(n int) Option {
   257â†’    return func(c *Client) {
   258â†’        c.maxRetries = n
   259â†’    }
   260â†’}
   261â†’
   262â†’func NewClientWithOptions(opts ...Option) *Client {
   263â†’    c := &Client{
   264â†’        timeout:    30 * time.Second,
   265â†’        maxRetries: 3,
   266â†’    }
   267â†’    
   268â†’    for _, opt := range opts {
   269â†’        opt(c)
   270â†’    }
   271â†’    
   272â†’    return c
   273â†’}
   274â†’
   275â†’// Deprecation
   276â†’// Deprecated: Use NewClientWithOptions instead.
   277â†’func NewClientOld(endpoint string) *Client {
   278â†’    return NewClientWithOptions(WithEndpoint(endpoint))
   279â†’}
   280â†’```
   281â†’
   282â†’### Error Design
   283â†’```go
   284â†’package mypackage
   285â†’
   286â†’// Sentinel errors
   287â†’var (
   288â†’    ErrNotFound      = errors.New("not found")
   289â†’    ErrUnauthorized  = errors.New("unauthorized")
   290â†’    ErrInvalidInput  = errors.New("invalid input")
   291â†’)
   292â†’
   293â†’// Error types
   294â†’type ValidationError struct {
   295â†’    Field   string
   296â†’    Message string
   297â†’}
   298â†’
   299â†’func (e ValidationError) Error() string {
   300â†’    return fmt.Sprintf("validation error on field %s: %s", e.Field, e.Message)
   301â†’}
   302â†’
   303â†’// Error wrapping
   304â†’func GetUser(id string) (*User, error) {
   305â†’    user, err := db.Query(id)
   306â†’    if err != nil {
   307â†’        if errors.Is(err, sql.ErrNoRows) {
   308â†’            return nil, ErrNotFound
   309â†’        }
   310â†’        return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to get user %s: %w", id, err)
   311â†’    }
   312â†’    return user, nil
   313â†’}
   314â†’
   315â†’// Custom error checking
   316â†’func IsNotFound(err error) bool {
   317â†’    return errors.Is(err, ErrNotFound)
   318â†’}
   319â†’
   320â†’func IsValidation(err error) bool {
   321â†’    var validationErr ValidationError
   322â†’    return errors.As(err, &validationErr)
   323â†’}
   324â†’```

   373â†’### Internal Best Practices
   374â†’```go
   375â†’// Hide implementation details
   376â†’// Public package
   377â†’package user
   378â†’
   379â†’type Service interface {
   380â†’    GetUser(id string) (*User, error)
   381â†’}
   382â†’
   383â†’func NewService(db Database) Service {
   384â†’    return &service{
   385â†’        db: db,
   386â†’        validator: internal.NewValidator(),
   387â†’    }
   388â†’}
   389â†’
   390â†’// Internal package
   391â†’package internal
   392â†’
   393â†’type Validator struct {
   394â†’    rules []Rule
   395â†’}
   396â†’
   397â†’func NewValidator() *Validator {
   398â†’    // Hidden from external packages
   399â†’}
   400â†’
   401â†’// Share code between packages
   402â†’internal/
   403â†’â”œâ”€â”€ shared/
   404â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ logger/
   405â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ metrics/
   406â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ errors/
   407â†’
   408â†’// Use in multiple packages
   409â†’package service1
   410â†’import "myproject/internal/shared/logger"
   411â†’
   412â†’package service2
   413â†’import "myproject/internal/shared/logger"
   414â†’```

   416â†’## Versioning
   417â†’
   418â†’### Semantic Versioning
   419â†’```go
   420â†’// go.mod versioning
   421â†’module github.com/user/myproject
   422â†’
   423â†’go 1.21
   424â†’
   425â†’require (
   426â†’    github.com/some/dep v1.2.3   // Exact version
   427â†’    github.com/other/dep v2.0.0+incompatible
   428â†’    github.com/new/dep/v2 v2.1.0 // Major version in path
   429â†’)
   430â†’
   431â†’// Version tags
   432â†’// git tag v1.0.0
   433â†’// git tag v1.0.1
   434â†’// git tag v1.1.0
   435â†’// git tag v2.0.0
   436â†’
   437â†’// Major version changes (v2+)
   438â†’// Update module path
   439â†’module github.com/user/myproject/v2
   440â†’
   441â†’// Import with version
   442â†’import "github.com/user/myproject/v2/pkg/client"
   443â†’
   444â†’// Maintaining multiple versions
   445â†’myproject/
   446â†’â”œâ”€â”€ go.mod          // module github.com/user/myproject
   447â†’â””â”€â”€ v2/
   448â†’    â””â”€â”€ go.mod      // module github.com/user/myproject/v2
   449â†’
   450â†’// Version constraints
   451â†’require (
   452â†’    github.com/some/dep v1.2.3     // Exact
   453â†’    github.com/some/dep v1.2.x     // Patch updates
   454â†’    github.com/some/dep v1.x.x     // Minor updates
   455â†’    github.com/some/dep latest     // Latest
   456â†’    github.com/some/dep master     // Branch
   457â†’)
   458â†’```
   459â†’
   460â†’### API Versioning
   461â†’```go
   462â†’// Package versioning
   463â†’api/
   464â†’â”œâ”€â”€ v1/
   465â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ client.go
   466â†’â””â”€â”€ v2/
   467â†’    â””â”€â”€ client.go
   468â†’
   469â†’// v1/client.go
   470â†’package v1
   471â†’
   472â†’type Client struct {
   473â†’    Endpoint string
   474â†’}
   475â†’
   476â†’func (c *Client) Request(data string) (string, error) {
   477â†’    // v1 implementation
   478â†’}
   479â†’
   480â†’// v2/client.go
   481â†’package v2
   482â†’
   483â†’type Client struct {
   484â†’    Endpoint string
   485â†’    Timeout  time.Duration  // New field
   486â†’}
   487â†’
   488â†’func (c *Client) Request(ctx context.Context, data []byte) ([]byte, error) {
   489â†’    // v2 implementation with context
   490â†’}
   491â†’
   492â†’// Supporting multiple versions
   493â†’package api
   494â†’
   495â†’import (
   496â†’    v1 "myproject/api/v1"
   497â†’    v2 "myproject/api/v2"
   498â†’)
   499â†’
   500â†’func NewClientV1() *v1.Client {
   501â†’    return &v1.Client{}
   502â†’}
   503â†’
   504â†’func NewClientV2() *v2.Client {
   505â†’    return &v2.Client{}
   506â†’}
   507â†’```

   509â†’## Documentation
   510â†’
   511â†’### Package Documentation
   512â†’```go
   513â†’// Package documentation (doc.go)
   514â†’/*
   515â†’Package user provides user management functionality for the application.
   516â†’
   517â†’The package includes:
   518â†’  - User CRUD operations
   519â†’  - Authentication and authorization
   520â†’  - Profile management
   521â†’  - Password reset functionality
   522â†’
   523â†’Basic usage:
   524â†’
   525â†’	service := user.NewService(db)
   526â†’	
   527â†’	// Create user
   528â†’	u, err := service.Create(ctx, user.CreateRequest{
   529â†’		Email:    "user@example.com",
   530â†’		Password: "secure123",
   531â†’	})
   532â†’	
   533â†’	// Authenticate
   534â†’	token, err := service.Authenticate(ctx, email, password)
   535â†’
   536â†’For more examples, see the examples directory.
   537â†’*/
   538â†’package user
   539â†’
   540â†’// Type documentation
   541â†’// User represents a system user.
   542â†’// Users can have multiple roles and permissions.
   543â†’type User struct {
   544â†’    // ID is the unique identifier for the user.
   545â†’    ID string
   546â†’    
   547â†’    // Email is the user's email address.
   548â†’    // It must be unique across all users.
   549â†’    Email string
   550â†’    
   551â†’    // CreatedAt is when the user was created.
   552â†’    CreatedAt time.Time
   553â†’    
   554â†’    // Roles contains the user's assigned roles.
   555â†’    Roles []Role
   556â†’}
   557â†’
   558â†’// Method documentation
   559â†’// Create creates a new user with the given request.
   560â†’// It returns an error if the email already exists or validation fails.
   561â†’//
   562â†’// Example:
   563â†’//
   564â†’//	user, err := service.Create(ctx, CreateRequest{
   565â†’//	    Email:    "user@example.com",
   566â†’//	    Password: "secure123",
   567â†’//	})
   568â†’//	if err != nil {
   569â†’//	    log.Fatal(err)
   570â†’//	}
   571â†’func (s *Service) Create(ctx context.Context, req CreateRequest) (*User, error) {
   572â†’    // Implementation
   573â†’}
   574â†’
   575â†’// Deprecated documentation
   576â†’// Deprecated: Use CreateWithOptions instead.
   577â†’// This function will be removed in v2.0.0.
   578â†’func (s *Service) CreateOld(email, password string) (*User, error) {
   579â†’    return s.CreateWithOptions(CreateOptions{
   580â†’        Email:    email,
   581â†’        Password: password,
   582â†’    })
   583â†’}
   584â†’```

   739â†’## Dependencies
   740â†’
   741â†’### Managing Dependencies
   742â†’```go
   743â†’// Adding dependencies
   744â†’// go get github.com/pkg/errors
   745â†’// go get github.com/pkg/errors@v0.9.1
   746â†’// go get github.com/pkg/errors@latest
   747â†’// go get github.com/pkg/errors@master
   748â†’
   749â†’// Updating dependencies
   750â†’// go get -u                    - Update all
   751â†’// go get -u ./...             - Update all in module
   752â†’// go get -u=patch ./...       - Update patch versions
   753â†’// go get -u github.com/pkg/...  - Update specific package
   754â†’
   755â†’// Removing dependencies
   756â†’// go mod tidy                  - Remove unused
   757â†’
   758â†’// Vendoring
   759â†’// go mod vendor               - Create vendor/
   760â†’// go build -mod=vendor        - Build with vendor/
   761â†’
   762â†’// Dependency analysis
   763â†’import "golang.org/x/mod/modfile"
   764â†’
   765â†’func analyzeDependencies() {
   766â†’    data, _ := os.ReadFile("go.mod")
   767â†’    file, _ := modfile.Parse("go.mod", data, nil)
   768â†’    
   769â†’    for _, req := range file.Require {
   770â†’        fmt.Printf("%s: %s\n", req.Mod.Path, req.Mod.Version)
   771â†’    }
   772â†’}
   773â†’
   774â†’// Private dependencies
   775â†’// Set GOPRIVATE environment variable
   776â†’// GOPRIVATE=github.com/company/*
   777â†’
   778â†’// Use .netrc for authentication
   779â†’// machine github.com
   780â†’// login username
   781â†’// password token
   782â†’
   783â†’// Or use SSH
   784â†’// git config --global url."git@github.com:".insteadOf "https://github.com/"
   785â†’```
   786â†’
   787â†’### Dependency Injection
   788â†’```go
   789â†’// Constructor injection
   790â†’type Service struct {
   791â†’    db     Database
   792â†’    cache  Cache
   793â†’    logger Logger
   794â†’}
   795â†’
   796â†’func NewService(db Database, cache Cache, logger Logger) *Service {
   797â†’    return &Service{
   798â†’        db:     db,
   799â†’        cache:  cache,
   800â†’        logger: logger,
   801â†’    }
   802â†’}
   803â†’
   804â†’// Interface injection
   805â†’type Database interface {
   806â†’    Query(string) ([]Row, error)
   807â†’}
   808â†’
   809â†’type Cache interface {
   810â†’    Get(string) (interface{}, bool)
   811â†’    Set(string, interface{})
   812â†’}
   813â†’
   814â†’// Wire for dependency injection
   815â†’//go:build wireinject
   816â†’
   817â†’import "github.com/google/wire"
   818â†’
   819â†’func InitializeService() (*Service, error) {
   820â†’    wire.Build(
   821â†’        NewDatabase,
   822â†’        NewCache,
   823â†’        NewLogger,
   824â†’        NewService,
   825â†’    )
   826â†’    return nil, nil
   827â†’}
   828â†’
   829â†’// Provider sets
   830â†’var BasicSet = wire.NewSet(
   831â†’    NewDatabase,
   832â†’    NewCache,
   833â†’    NewLogger,
   834â†’)
   835â†’
   836â†’var ServiceSet = wire.NewSet(
   837â†’    BasicSet,
   838â†’    NewService,
   839â†’    NewRepository,
   840â†’)
   841â†’```
   842â†’
   843â†’## Package Patterns
   844â†’
   845â†’### Plugin Pattern
   846â†’```go
   847â†’// Plugin interface
   848â†’package plugin
   849â†’
   850â†’type Plugin interface {
   851â†’    Name() string
   852â†’    Initialize(config map[string]interface{}) error
   853â†’    Execute(context.Context, interface{}) (interface{}, error)
   854â†’    Shutdown() error
   855â†’}
   856â†’
   857â†’// Registry
   858â†’type Registry struct {
   859â†’    mu      sync.RWMutex
   860â†’    plugins map[string]Plugin
   861â†’}
   862â†’
   863â†’func (r *Registry) Register(p Plugin) {
   864â†’    r.mu.Lock()
   865â†’    defer r.mu.Unlock()
   866â†’    r.plugins[p.Name()] = p
   867â†’}
   868â†’
   869â†’func (r *Registry) Get(name string) (Plugin, bool) {
   870â†’    r.mu.RLock()
   871â†’    defer r.mu.RUnlock()
   872â†’    p, ok := r.plugins[name]
   873â†’    return p, ok
   874â†’}
   875â†’
   876â†’// Plugin implementation
   877â†’package myplugin
   878â†’
   879â†’type MyPlugin struct {
   880â†’    config map[string]interface{}
   881â†’}
   882â†’
   883â†’func (p *MyPlugin) Name() string {
   884â†’    return "my-plugin"
   885â†’}
   886â†’
   887â†’func (p *MyPlugin) Initialize(config map[string]interface{}) error {
   888â†’    p.config = config
   889â†’    return nil
   890â†’}
   891â†’
   892â†’// Auto-registration
   893â†’func init() {
   894â†’    plugin.DefaultRegistry.Register(&MyPlugin{})
   895â†’}
   896â†’```
   897â†’
   898â†’### Provider Pattern
   899â†’```go
   900â†’// Provider interface
   901â†’package provider
   902â†’
   903â†’type StorageProvider interface {
   904â†’    Read(key string) ([]byte, error)
   905â†’    Write(key string, data []byte) error
   906â†’    Delete(key string) error
   907â†’}
   908â†’
   909â†’// Factory
   910â†’type ProviderFactory func(config Config) (StorageProvider, error)
   911â†’
   912â†’var providers = make(map[string]ProviderFactory)
   913â†’
   914â†’func Register(name string, factory ProviderFactory) {
   915â†’    providers[name] = factory
   916â†’}
   917â†’
   918â†’func New(name string, config Config) (StorageProvider, error) {
   919â†’    factory, ok := providers[name]
   920â†’    if !ok {
   921â†’        return nil, fmt.Errorf("unknown provider: %s", name)
   922â†’    }
   923â†’    return factory(config)
   924â†’}
   925â†’
   926â†’// S3 provider
   927â†’package s3
   928â†’
   929â†’func init() {
   930â†’    provider.Register("s3", NewS3Provider)
   931â†’}
   932â†’
   933â†’func NewS3Provider(config provider.Config) (provider.StorageProvider, error) {
   934â†’    return &S3Provider{
   935â†’        bucket: config.Get("bucket"),
   936â†’        region: config.Get("region"),
   937â†’    }, nil
   938â†’}
   939â†’```
   940â†’
   941â†’### Repository Pattern
   942â†’```go
   943â†’package repository
   944â†’
   945â†’// Generic repository interface
   946â†’type Repository[T any] interface {
   947â†’    Find(ctx context.Context, id string) (*T, error)
   948â†’    FindAll(ctx context.Context) ([]*T, error)
   949â†’    Create(ctx context.Context, entity *T) error
   950â†’    Update(ctx context.Context, entity *T) error
   951â†’    Delete(ctx context.Context, id string) error
   952â†’}
   953â†’
   954â†’// Specific implementation
   955â†’type UserRepository interface {
   956â†’    Repository[User]
   957â†’    FindByEmail(ctx context.Context, email string) (*User, error)
   958â†’    FindByRole(ctx context.Context, role string) ([]*User, error)
   959â†’}
   960â†’
   961â†’// SQL implementation
   962â†’type sqlUserRepository struct {
   963â†’    db *sql.DB
   964â†’}
   965â†’
   966â†’func NewSQLUserRepository(db *sql.DB) UserRepository {
   967â†’    return &sqlUserRepository{db: db}
   968â†’}
   969â†’
   970â†’func (r *sqlUserRepository) Find(ctx context.Context, id string) (*User, error) {
   971â†’    query := `SELECT id, email, created_at FROM users WHERE id = $1`
   972â†’    // Implementation
   973â†’}
   974â†’
   975â†’// MongoDB implementation
   976â†’type mongoUserRepository struct {
   977â†’    collection *mongo.Collection
   978â†’}
   979â†’
   980â†’func NewMongoUserRepository(db *mongo.Database) UserRepository {
   981â†’    return &mongoUserRepository{
   982â†’        collection: db.Collection("users"),
   983â†’    }
   984â†’}
   985â†’```
   986â†’
   987â†’## Publishing Packages
   988â†’
   989â†’### Preparing for Publication
   990â†’```go
   991â†’// 1. Choose a good name
   992â†’// - Descriptive and unique
   993â†’// - Avoid generic names (utils, helpers, common)
   994â†’// - Check if name is available
   995â†’
   996â†’// 2. Create comprehensive documentation
   997â†’// - README.md with examples
   998â†’// - Package documentation
   999â†’// - API documentation
  1000â†’// - CONTRIBUTING.md
  1001â†’// - LICENSE file
  1002â†’
  1003â†’// 3. Add examples
  1004â†’examples/
  1005â†’â”œâ”€â”€ basic/
  1006â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ main.go
  1007â†’â”œâ”€â”€ advanced/
  1008â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ main.go
  1009â†’â””â”€â”€ README.md
  1010â†’
  1011â†’// 4. Write comprehensive tests
  1012â†’// - Unit tests
  1013â†’// - Integration tests
  1014â†’// - Benchmarks
  1015â†’// - Examples
  1016â†’
  1017â†’// 5. Set up CI/CD
  1018â†’// .github/workflows/test.yml
  1019â†’name: Test
  1020â†’on: [push, pull_request]
  1021â†’jobs:
  1022â†’  test:
  1023â†’    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  1024â†’    steps:
  1025â†’    - uses: actions/checkout@v2
  1026â†’    - uses: actions/setup-go@v2
  1027â†’      with:
  1028â†’        go-version: 1.21
  1029â†’    - run: go test -v ./...
  1030â†’    - run: go test -race ./...
  1031â†’    - run: go test -cover ./...
  1032â†’```
  1033â†’
  1034â†’### Publishing Process
  1035â†’```bash
  1036â†’# 1. Tag version
  1037â†’git tag v1.0.0
  1038â†’git push origin v1.0.0
  1039â†’
  1040â†’# 2. The package is automatically available
  1041â†’# go get github.com/username/package@v1.0.0
  1042â†’
  1043â†’# 3. Update pkg.go.dev
  1044â†’# Visit https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/username/package
  1045â†’# Click "Request" button
  1046â†’
  1047â†’# 4. Add badges to README
  1048â†’[![Go Reference](https://pkg.go.dev/badge/github.com/username/package.svg)](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/username/package)
  1049â†’[![Go Report Card](https://goreportcard.com/badge/github.com/username/package)](https://goreportcard.com/report/github.com/username/package)
  1050â†’[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/repos/github/username/package/badge.svg)](https://coveralls.io/github/username/package)
  1051â†’
  1052â†’# 5. Create release on GitHub
  1053â†’# - Add release notes
  1054â†’# - Attach binaries if applicable
  1055â†’```
  1056â†’
  1057â†’### Package Maintenance
  1058â†’```go
  1059â†’// Deprecation process
  1060â†’// 1. Mark as deprecated in documentation
  1061â†’// Deprecated: Use NewFunction instead.
  1062â†’// This will be removed in v2.0.0.
  1063â†’func OldFunction() {}
  1064â†’
  1065â†’// 2. Log deprecation warnings
  1066â†’func OldFunction() {
  1067â†’    log.Println("Warning: OldFunction is deprecated. Use NewFunction instead.")
  1068â†’    // Existing implementation
  1069â†’}
  1070â†’
  1071â†’// 3. Provide migration guide
  1072â†’/*
  1073â†’Migration Guide from v1 to v2:
  1074â†’
  1075â†’1. Replace OldFunction() with NewFunction()
  1076â†’2. Update Client struct initialization:
  1077â†’   Old: client := &Client{Endpoint: "url"}
  1078â†’   New: client := NewClient(WithEndpoint("url"))
  1079â†’3. Change import path:
  1080â†’   Old: import "github.com/user/package"
  1081â†’   New: import "github.com/user/package/v2"
  1082â†’*/
  1083â†’
  1084â†’// Version compatibility
  1085â†’// Support multiple versions
  1086â†’package compat
  1087â†’
  1088â†’import (
  1089â†’    v1 "mypackage/v1"
  1090â†’    v2 "mypackage/v2"
  1091â†’)
  1092â†’
  1093â†’func MigrateV1ToV2(old *v1.Config) *v2.Config {
  1094â†’    return &v2.Config{
  1095â†’        // Map old fields to new
  1096â†’    }
  1097â†’}
  1098â†’```
  1099â†’
  1100â†’## Best Practices
  1101â†’
  1102â†’### Package Design Principles
  1103â†’```go
  1104â†’// 1. Single Responsibility
  1105â†’// Each package should have one clear purpose
  1106â†’
  1107â†’// 2. Minimal Public API
  1108â†’// Export only what's necessary
  1109â†’package mypackage
  1110â†’
  1111â†’type Client struct{} // Exported
  1112â†’
  1113â†’type implementation struct{} // Unexported
  1114â†’
  1115â†’// 3. Accept Interfaces, Return Structs
  1116â†’func Process(r io.Reader) *Result {
  1117â†’    // Accept interface for flexibility
  1118â†’    // Return concrete type for clarity
  1119â†’}
  1120â†’
  1121â†’// 4. Avoid Init Functions
  1122â†’// Bad: Side effects on import
  1123â†’func init() {
  1124â†’    database.Connect() // Side effect!
  1125â†’}
  1126â†’
  1127â†’// Good: Explicit initialization
  1128â†’func Initialize() error {
  1129â†’    return database.Connect()
  1130â†’}
  1131â†’
  1132â†’// 5. No Circular Dependencies
  1133â†’// Use interfaces to break cycles
  1134â†’
  1135â†’// 6. Consistent Naming
  1136â†’// Package name should match directory name
  1137â†’// Avoid stuttering: user.User not user.UserUser
  1138â†’
  1139â†’// 7. Semantic Versioning
  1140â†’// Follow semver strictly
  1141â†’// Major.Minor.Patch
  1142â†’
  1143â†’// 8. Comprehensive Testing
  1144â†’// Aim for >80% coverage
  1145â†’// Include edge cases
  1146â†’
  1147â†’// 9. Clear Documentation
  1148â†’// Document all exports
  1149â†’// Provide examples
  1150â†’
  1151â†’// 10. Minimal Dependencies
  1152â†’// Avoid unnecessary dependencies
  1153â†’// Vendor or ensure stability
  1154â†’```
  1155â†’
  1156â†’### Common Pitfalls
  1157â†’```go
  1158â†’// 1. Overusing init()
  1159â†’// Avoid side effects on import
  1160â†’
  1161â†’// 2. God packages
  1162â†’// Don't create packages that do everything
  1163â†’
  1164â†’// 3. Premature abstraction
  1165â†’// Start simple, refactor when needed
  1166â†’
  1167â†’// 4. Ignoring internal/
  1168â†’// Use internal/ for non-public code
  1169â†’
  1170â†’// 5. Poor error messages
  1171â†’// Provide context in errors
  1172â†’
  1173â†’// 6. Breaking changes in minor versions
  1174â†’// Use major version for breaking changes
  1175â†’
  1176â†’// 7. No examples
  1177â†’// Always provide usage examples
  1178â†’
  1179â†’// 8. Inconsistent API
  1180â†’// Maintain consistency across package
  1181â†’
  1182â†’// 9. Global state
  1183â†’// Avoid package-level variables
  1184â†’
  1185â†’// 10. Missing context support
  1186â†’// Accept context.Context in long operations
  1187â†’```
  1188â†’
  1189â†’## Best Practices Summary
  1190â†’
  1191â†’1. **Design cohesive packages** - Single, clear purpose
  1192â†’2. **Minimize public API** - Export only what's necessary  
  1193â†’3. **Use internal packages** - Hide implementation details
  1194â†’4. **Follow semantic versioning** - Major.Minor.Patch
  1195â†’5. **Document thoroughly** - Package, types, functions
  1196â†’6. **Provide examples** - Show common usage patterns
  1197â†’7. **Accept interfaces** - Return concrete types
  1198â†’8. **Avoid circular dependencies** - Use interfaces to break cycles
  1199â†’9. **Test comprehensively** - Unit, integration, benchmarks
  1200â†’10. **Maintain backwards compatibility** - Use versioning for breaking changes

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it looks malicious. If it does, you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer high-level questions about the code behavior.
