  1144â†’// Aim for >80% coverage
  1145â†’// Include edge cases
  1146â†’
  1147â†’// 9. Clear Documentation
  1148â†’// Document all exports
  1149â†’// Provide examples
  1150â†’
  1151â†’// 10. Minimal Dependencies
  1152â†’// Avoid unnecessary dependencies
  1153â†’// Vendor or ensure stability
  1154â†’```
  1155â†’
  1156â†’### Common Pitfalls
  1157â†’```go
  1158â†’// 1. Overusing init()
  1159â†’// Avoid side effects on import
  1160â†’
  1161â†’// 2. God packages
  1162â†’// Don't create packages that do everything
  1163â†’
  1164â†’// 3. Premature abstraction
  1165â†’// Start simple, refactor when needed
  1166â†’
  1167â†’// 4. Ignoring internal/
  1168â†’// Use internal/ for non-public code
  1169â†’
  1170â†’// 5. Poor error messages
  1171â†’// Provide context in errors
  1172â†’
  1173â†’// 6. Breaking changes in minor versions
  1174â†’// Use major version for breaking changes
  1175â†’
  1176â†’// 7. No examples
  1177â†’// Always provide usage examples
  1178â†’
  1179â†’// 8. Inconsistent API
  1180â†’// Maintain consistency across package
  1181â†’
  1182â†’// 9. Global state
  1183â†’// Avoid package-level variables
  1184â†’
  1185â†’// 10. Missing context support
  1186â†’// Accept context.Context in long operations

  1188â†’
  1189â†’## Best Practices Summary
  1190â†’
  1191â†’1. **Design cohesive packages** - Single, clear purpose
  1192â†’2. **Minimize public API** - Export only what's necessary  
  1193â†’3. **Use internal packages** - Hide implementation details
  1194â†’4. **Follow semantic versioning** - Major.Minor.Patch
  1195â†’5. **Document thoroughly** - Package, types, functions
  1196â†’6. **Provide examples** - Show common usage patterns
  1197â†’7. **Accept interfaces** - Return concrete types
  1198â†’8. **Avoid circular dependencies** - Use interfaces to break cycles
  1199â†’9. **Test comprehensively** - Unit, integration, benchmarks
  1200â†’10. **Maintain backwards compatibility** - Use versioning for breaking changes

1â†’# Big Meanie Project Conventions
     2â†’
     3â†’## Philosophy
     4â†’
     5â†’Big Meanie follows a radical simplicity approach: **break fast, fix immediately**. We prioritize clean breaks over compatibility layers because hidden issues compound exponentially. A breaking change that forces immediate fixes is better than subtle bugs that surface months later in production.
     6â†’
     7â†’## Table of Contents
     8â†’1. [Core Philosophy](#core-philosophy)
     9â†’2. [Naming Conventions](#naming-conventions)
    10â†’3. [No Backwards Compatibility](#no-backwards-compatibility)
    11â†’4. [Project Structure](#project-structure)
    12â†’5. [File Management](#file-management)
    13â†’6. [Code Organization](#code-organization)
    14â†’7. [Testing Standards](#testing-standards)
    15â†’8. [Documentation Rules](#documentation-rules)
    16â†’
    17â†’## Core Philosophy
    18â†’
    19â†’### The Big Meanie Way
    20â†’
    21â†’```go
    22â†’// We value:
    23â†’// 1. Clarity over cleverness
    24â†’// 2. Breaking changes over hidden complexity
    25â†’// 3. Direct solutions over abstractions
    26â†’// 4. Fast failures over graceful degradation
    27â†’// 5. Today's correctness over tomorrow's flexibility
    28â†’```
    29â†’
    30â†’### Design Principles
    31â†’
    32â†’```go
    33â†’// BAD: Maintaining compatibility
    34â†’type OrderService interface {
    35â†’    PlaceOrder(order Order) error
    36â†’    PlaceOrderV2(order OrderV2) error  // NEVER DO THIS
    37â†’}
    38â†’
    39â†’// GOOD: Clean break
    40â†’type OrderService interface {
    41â†’    PlaceOrder(order Order) error  // Just change it
    42â†’}
    43â†’
    44â†’// BAD: Migration code
    45â†’func MigrateData() {
    46â†’    if isOldFormat() {
    47â†’        convertToNew()  // NEVER DO THIS
    48â†’    }
    49â†’}
    50â†’
    51â†’// GOOD: Direct cutover
    52â†’func LoadData() {
    53â†’    // Assume new format only
    54â†’    // Old format fails fast
    55â†’}
    56â†’```
    57â†’
    58â†’## Naming Conventions
    59â†’
    60â†’### Concise Names
    61â†’
    62â†’Big Meanie uses concise naming. We prefer short, clear names over verbose descriptions.
    63â†’
    64â†’```go
    65â†’// BAD: Verbose naming
    66â†’type SupportResistanceCalculator struct {
    67â†’    maximumLookbackPeriod int
    68â†’    minimumVolumeThreshold decimal.Decimal
    69â†’}
    70â†’
    71â†’func CalculateSupportAndResistanceLevels() {}
    72â†’func GetMovingAverageConvergenceDivergence() {}
    73â†’
    74â†’// GOOD: Concise
    75â†’type SRCalculator struct {  // Support/Resistance
    76â†’    maxLookback int
    77â†’    minVol decimal.Decimal
    78â†’}
    79â†’
    80â†’func CalcSR() {}
    81â†’func MACD() {}
    82â†’```
    83â†’
    84â†’### Standard Abbreviations
    85â†’
    86â†’```go
    87â†’// Common trading abbreviations
    88â†’SR   // Support/Resistance
    89â†’MA   // Moving Average
    90â†’EMA  // Exponential Moving Average
    91â†’RSI  // Relative Strength Index
    92â†’MACD // Moving Average Convergence Divergence
    93â†’BB   // Bollinger Bands
    94â†’ATR  // Average True Range
    95â†’OBV  // On-Balance Volume
    96â†’MFI  // Money Flow Index
    97â†’
    98â†’// System abbreviations
    99â†’cfg  // config
   100â†’ctx  // context
   101â†’conn // connection
   102â†’db   // database
   103â†’err  // error
   104â†’msg  // message
   105â†’req  // request
   106â†’res  // response/result
   107â†’tx   // transaction
   108â†’
   109â†’// Trading specific
   110â†’qty  // quantity
   111â†’vol  // volume
   112â†’pos  // position
   113â†’pnl  // profit and loss
   114â†’nav  // net asset value
   115â†’liq  // liquidation/liquidity
   116â†’```
   117â†’
   118â†’### Method Names
   119â†’
   120â†’```go
   121â†’// Prefer short verbs
   122â†’Calc()  not  Calculate()
   123â†’Exec()  not  Execute()
   124â†’Init()  not  Initialize()
   125â†’Proc()  not  Process()
   126â†’Gen()   not  Generate()
   127â†’
   128â†’// Getters don't use Get
   129â†’Price()     not  GetPrice()
   130â†’Quantity()  not  GetQuantity()
   131â†’
   132â†’// Setters use Set
   133â†’SetPrice()
   134â†’SetQuantity()
   135â†’
   136â†’// Boolean methods
   137â†’IsValid()   not  CheckIfValid()
   138â†’HasData()   not  CheckHasData()
   139â†’CanTrade()  not  CheckCanTrade()
   140â†’```
   141â†’
   142â†’## No Backwards Compatibility
   143â†’
   144â†’### Breaking Changes Are Good
   145â†’
   146â†’```go
   147â†’// BAD: Versioned APIs
   148â†’func (api *API) RegisterHandlers() {
   149â†’    api.HandleFunc("/v1/orders", ordersV1Handler)
   150â†’    api.HandleFunc("/v2/orders", ordersV2Handler)  // NEVER
   151â†’}
   152â†’
   153â†’// GOOD: One version only
   154â†’func (api *API) RegisterHandlers() {
   155â†’    api.HandleFunc("/orders", ordersHandler)  // Break it, fix it
   156â†’}
   157â†’
   158â†’// BAD: Compatibility fields
   159â†’type Order struct {
   160â†’    ID       string
   161â†’    Price    decimal.Decimal
   162â†’
   163â†’    // Deprecated: Use Price instead
   164â†’    PriceStr string  // NEVER KEEP THIS
   165â†’}
   166â†’
   167â†’// GOOD: Clean structure
   168â†’type Order struct {
   169â†’    ID    string
   170â†’    Price decimal.Decimal  // Changed? Fix all usages
   171â†’}
   172â†’```
   173â†’
   174â†’### Migration Anti-Patterns to Avoid
   175â†’
   176â†’```go
   177â†’// NEVER: Gradual migration
   178â†’func LoadConfig() Config {
   179â†’    if FileExists("config.yaml") {
   180â†’        return LoadYAML()
   181â†’    }
   182â†’    // Fallback to old format
   183â†’    return LoadJSON()  // NEVER DO THIS
   184â†’}
   185â†’
   186â†’// ALWAYS: Direct cutover
   187â†’func LoadConfig() Config {
   188â†’    return LoadYAML()  // Old format fails immediately
   189â†’}
   190â†’
   191â†’// NEVER: Adapter patterns
   192â†’type LegacyAdapter struct {
   193â†’    newService *Service
   194â†’}
   195â†’
   196â†’func (a *LegacyAdapter) OldMethod() {
   197â†’    a.newService.NewMethod()  // NEVER BUILD ADAPTERS
   198â†’}
   199â†’
   200â†’// ALWAYS: Direct replacement
   201â†’// Just change OldMethod to NewMethod everywhere
   202â†’```
   203â†’
   204â†’### Database Migration Rules
   205â†’
   206â†’```sql
   207â†’-- BAD: Maintaining old columns
   208â†’ALTER TABLE orders ADD COLUMN price_decimal DECIMAL(20,8);
   209â†’UPDATE orders SET price_decimal = CAST(price_string AS DECIMAL);
   210â†’-- Keep both columns during "transition" - NEVER
   211â†’
   212â†’-- GOOD: Direct replacement
   213â†’ALTER TABLE orders DROP COLUMN price_string;
   214â†’ALTER TABLE orders ADD COLUMN price DECIMAL(20,8) NOT NULL;
   215â†’-- Breaks immediately, forces data migration
   216â†’```
   217â†’
   218â†’## Project Structure
   219â†’
   220â†’### Directory Layout
   221â†’
   222â†’```
   223â†’bigmeanie/
   224â†’â”œâ”€â”€ back/                 # Backend code
   225â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ .docs/           # Documentation (hidden)
   226â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ archive/     # Historical docs (DO NOT REFERENCE)
   227â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ code/        # Developer guidelines
   228â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ pinescripts/ # TradingView source scripts
   229â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ plan.md      # Current planning
   230â†’â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ todo.md      # Task tracking
   231â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ .snippets/       # Code patterns and examples (hidden)
   232â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ internal/        # Private packages (future)
   233â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ pkg/             # Public packages
   234â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ clock/       # Time abstraction for testing
   235â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ decimal_math/# High-precision math utilities
   236â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ errors/      # Structured error handling framework
   237â†’â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ safego/      # Safe goroutine management for 24/7 operations
   238â†’â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ indicators/  # Technical analysis indicators
   239â†’â”‚   â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ common/  # Standard indicators (RSI, ATR, VWAP)
   240â†’â”‚   â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ pinescript/# Advanced indicators (ZLTS, MTO, AVOP)
   241â†’â”‚   â”‚       â””â”€â”€ vol_delta/# Volume delta calculations
   242â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ go.mod
   243â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ README.md
   244â†’â””â”€â”€ front/               # Frontend code
   245â†’    â””â”€â”€ README.md        # Currently empty - backend focus
   246â†’```
   247â†’
   248â†’### Package Organization
   249â†’
   250â†’```go
   251â†’// Each package has single responsibility
   252â†’// internal/engine/engine.go
   253â†’package engine
   254â†’
   255â†’type Engine struct {
   256â†’    // Only engine-related fields
   257â†’}
   258â†’
   259â†’// internal/strategy/strategy.go
   260â†’package strategy
   261â†’
   262â†’type Strategy interface {
   263â†’    // Only strategy methods
   264â†’}
   265â†’
   266â†’// Never mix concerns in one package
   267â†’// BAD: internal/trading/everything.go
   268â†’// GOOD: Separate packages for separate concerns
   269â†’```
   270â†’
   271â†’## File Management
   272â†’
   273â†’### No Variant Files
   274â†’
   275â†’```go
   276â†’// NEVER create these files:
   277â†’order.go
   278â†’order_v2.go      // NEVER
   279â†’order_new.go     // NEVER
   280â†’order_enhanced.go // NEVER
   281â†’order_refactored.go // NEVER
   282â†’
   283â†’// ALWAYS update the original:
   284â†’order.go  // Just change this file
   285â†’```
   286â†’
   287â†’### File Naming
   288â†’
   289â†’```go
   290â†’// Standard Go conventions
   291â†’order.go        // Types and methods
   292â†’order_test.go   // Tests
   293â†’doc.go         // Package documentation
   294â†’
   295â†’// Group by feature, not by type
   296â†’// BAD structure:
   297â†’types.go       // All types
   298â†’methods.go     // All methods
   299â†’interfaces.go  // All interfaces
   300â†’
   301â†’// GOOD structure:
   302â†’order.go       // Order type and methods
   303â†’trade.go       // Trade type and methods
   304â†’portfolio.go   // Portfolio type and methods
   305â†’```
   306â†’
   307â†’### Import Organization
   308â†’
   309â†’```go
   310â†’import (
   311â†’    // Standard library
   312â†’    "context"
   313â†’    "fmt"
   314â†’
   315â†’    // External dependencies
   316â†’    "github.com/shopspring/decimal"
   317â†’
   318â†’    // Internal packages
   319â†’    "bigmeanie/internal/engine"
   320â†’    "bigmeanie/pkg/indicators"
   321â†’)
   322â†’
   323â†’// Never use relative imports
   324â†’// BAD:  import "../engine"
   325â†’// GOOD: import "bigmeanie/internal/engine"
   326â†’```
   327â†’
   328â†’## Code Organization
   329â†’
   330â†’### Interface Design
   331â†’
   332â†’```go
   333â†’// Small, focused interfaces
   334â†’type Trader interface {
   335â†’    Trade(ctx context.Context, signal Signal) error
   336â†’}
   337â†’
   338â†’// Not large, kitchen-sink interfaces
   339â†’type BadTrader interface {
   340â†’    Trade() error
   341â†’    GetBalance() decimal.Decimal
   342â†’    GetHistory() []Trade
   343â†’    Configure(Config) error
   344â†’    // ... 20 more methods - NO!
   345â†’}
   346â†’
   347â†’// Compose interfaces when needed
   348â†’type FullTrader interface {
   349â†’    Trader
   350â†’    Backtester
   351â†’    Reporter
   352â†’}
   353â†’```
   354â†’
   355â†’### Error Handling
   356â†’
   357â†’```go
   358â†’// Always wrap errors with context
   359â†’if err != nil {
   360â†’    return fmt.Errorf("engine.Start: %w", err)
   361â†’}
   362â†’
   363â†’// Define sentinel errors
   364â†’var (
   365â†’    ErrInsufficientFunds = errors.New("insufficient funds")
   366â†’    ErrOrderTooSmall     = errors.New("order below minimum")
   367â†’    ErrExchangeDown      = errors.New("exchange unavailable")
   368â†’)
   369â†’
   370â†’// Use errors.Is for checking
   371â†’if errors.Is(err, ErrInsufficientFunds) {
   372â†’    // Handle specific error
   373â†’}
   374â†’```
   375â†’
   376â†’### Concurrency Patterns
   377â†’
   378â†’```go
   379â†’// Always use context for cancellation
   380â†’func (e *Engine) Run(ctx context.Context) error {
   381â†’    for {
   382â†’        select {
   383â†’        case <-ctx.Done():
   384â†’            return ctx.Err()
   385â†’        case signal := <-e.signals:
   386â†’            e.process(signal)
   387â†’        }
   388â†’    }
   389â†’}
   390â†’
   391â†’// Protect shared state
   392â†’type Portfolio struct {
   393â†’    mu       sync.RWMutex
   394â†’    balances map[string]decimal.Decimal
   395â†’}
   396â†’
   397â†’func (p *Portfolio) Balance(asset string) decimal.Decimal {
   398â†’    p.mu.RLock()
   399â†’    defer p.mu.RUnlock()
   400â†’    return p.balances[asset]
   401â†’}
   402â†’```
   403â†’
   404â†’## Testing Standards
   405â†’
   406â†’### Test Organization
   407â†’
   408â†’```go
   409â†’// Table-driven tests always
   410â†’func TestCalcSR(t *testing.T) {
   411â†’    tests := []struct {
   412â†’        name string
   413â†’        data []decimal.Decimal
   414â†’        want []Level
   415â†’    }{
   416â†’        {
   417â†’            name: "basic support",
   418â†’            data: []decimal.Decimal{...},
   419â†’            want: []Level{...},
   420â†’        },
   421â†’    }
   422â†’
   423â†’    for _, tt := range tests {
   424â†’        t.Run(tt.name, func(t *testing.T) {
   425â†’            got := CalcSR(tt.data)
   426â†’            require.Equal(t, tt.want, got)
   427â†’        })
   428â†’    }
   429â†’}
   430â†’
   431â†’// NEVER use t.Skip()
   432â†’// BAD:
   433â†’func TestBrokenFeature(t *testing.T) {
   434â†’    t.Skip("Fix later")  // NEVER
   435â†’}
   436â†’
   437â†’// GOOD: Fix it or delete it
   438â†’```
   439â†’
   440â†’### Test Coverage
   441â†’
   442â†’```go
   443â†’// Test edge cases
   444â†’func TestDivision(t *testing.T) {
   445â†’    // Test zero division
   446â†’    _, err := Divide(decimal.NewFromInt(1), decimal.Zero)
   447â†’    require.Error(t, err)
   448â†’
   449â†’    // Test negative values
   450â†’    result := Divide(decimal.NewFromInt(-10), decimal.NewFromInt(2))
   451â†’    require.Equal(t, decimal.NewFromInt(-5), result)
   452â†’}
   453â†’
   454â†’// Benchmark hot paths
   455â†’func BenchmarkCalcSR(b *testing.B) {
   456â†’    data := generatePriceData(1000)
   457â†’    b.ResetTimer()
   458â†’
   459â†’    for i := 0; i < b.N; i++ {
   460â†’        CalcSR(data)
   461â†’    }
   462â†’}
   463â†’```
   464â†’
   465â†’## Documentation Rules
   466â†’
   467â†’### Code Comments
   468â†’
   469â†’```go
   470â†’// Document WHY, not WHAT
   471â†’// BAD:
   472â†’// Increment counter by 1
   473â†’counter++
   474â†’
   475â†’// GOOD:
   476â†’// Retry count for exchange rate limiting
   477â†’counter++
   478â†’
   479â†’// Document edge cases
   480â†’// Returns -1 if no valid price found
   481â†’func FindPrice(prices []decimal.Decimal) decimal.Decimal {
   482â†’    // ...
   483â†’}
   484â†’
   485â†’// Document assumptions
   486â†’// Assumes prices are sorted in ascending order
   487â†’func BinarySearch(prices []decimal.Decimal, target decimal.Decimal) int {
   488â†’    // ...
   489â†’}
   490â†’```
   491â†’
   492â†’### Package Documentation
   493â†’
   494â†’```go
   495â†’// Package engine implements the core trading engine for Big Meanie.
   496â†’//
   497â†’// The engine coordinates between strategy signals, risk management,
   498â†’// and exchange execution. It runs continuously, processing signals
   499â†’// and managing positions according to configured strategies.
   500â†’//
   501â†’// Basic usage:
   502â†’//
   503â†’//	cfg := engine.DefaultConfig()
   504â†’//	eng := engine.New(cfg)
   505â†’//	err := eng.Run(ctx)
   506â†’//
   507â†’package engine
   508â†’```
   509â†’
   510â†’### README Files
   511â†’
   512â†’```markdown
   513â†’# Component Name
   514â†’
   515â†’## Purpose
   516â†’One paragraph explaining what this does and why it exists.
   517â†’
   518â†’## Usage
   519â†’Code examples showing common usage patterns.
   520â†’
   521â†’## Configuration
   522â†’Environment variables or config files needed.
   523â†’
   524â†’## Testing
   525â†’How to run tests for this component.
   526â†’
   527â†’Never create documentation unless explicitly requested.
   528â†’Document in code, not in separate files.
   529â†’```
   530â†’
   531â†’## Anti-Patterns to Avoid
   532â†’
   533â†’### Never Do These
   534â†’
   535â†’```go
   536â†’// 1. Backwards compatibility layers
   537â†’type Service struct {
   538â†’    v1Client *ClientV1
   539â†’    v2Client *ClientV2  // NEVER
   540â†’}
   541â†’
   542â†’// 2. Gradual migrations
   543â†’if useNewSystem {
   544â†’    processNew()
   545â†’} else {
   546â†’    processOld()  // NEVER
   547â†’}
   548â†’
   549â†’// 3. Deprecation warnings
   550â†’// Deprecated: Use NewMethod instead
   551â†’func OldMethod() {  // Just delete it
   552â†’}
   553â†’
   554â†’// 4. Feature flags for old behavior
   555â†’if featureFlag("use-old-algorithm") {  // NEVER
   556â†’    oldAlgorithm()
   557â†’}
   558â†’
   559â†’// 5. Compatibility shims
   560â†’func shimOldToNew(old Old) New {  // NEVER
   561â†’    // Convert old format to new
   562â†’}
   563â†’
   564â†’// 6. Variant files
   565â†’order_v2.go      // NEVER
   566â†’order_new.go     // NEVER
   567â†’order_temp.go    // NEVER
   568â†’
   569â†’// 7. TODO comments for compatibility
   570â†’// TODO: Remove after all clients updated  // NEVER
   571â†’```
   572â†’
   573â†’## Summary of Conventions
   574â†’
   575â†’1. **Concise naming** - SR not SupportResistance
   576â†’2. **No backwards compatibility** - Break it cleanly
   577â†’3. **No migration code** - Direct cutover only
   578â†’4. **No variant files** - Update the original
   579â†’5. **Fast failures** - Errors surface immediately
   580â†’6. **Single version** - No v1, v2 APIs
   581â†’7. **Clean breaks** - Force immediate fixes
   582â†’8. **Direct solutions** - No adapter patterns
   583â†’9. **Test everything** - Never skip tests
   584â†’10. **Document WHY** - Code explains what, comments explain why
   585â†’
   586â†’Remember: **Every line of compatibility code is technical debt.** Break fast, fix immediately, move forward.
   587â†’

# Decimal Patterns - shopspring/decimal for Financial Calculations

## Overview

Big Meanie uses shopspring/decimal for ALL numeric operations involving money, prices, quantities, and percentages. This ensures exact decimal arithmetic without floating-point rounding errors that could cost real money in trading operations.

## Table of Contents
1. [Core Principles](#core-principles)
2. [Basic Operations](#basic-operations)
3. [Trading-Specific Patterns](#trading-specific-patterns)
4. [Common Gotchas](#common-gotchas)
5. [Performance Considerations](#performance-considerations)
6. [Best Practices](#best-practices)

## Core Principles

```go
import "github.com/shopspring/decimal"

// NEVER use float64 for financial calculations
// BAD
price := 100.123  // float64 - NEVER DO THIS
total := price * 1.5

// GOOD
price := decimal.NewFromFloat(100.123)
total := price.Mul(decimal.NewFromFloat(1.5))

// BETTER - avoid float entirely
price := decimal.RequireFromString("100.123")
multiplier := decimal.RequireFromString("1.5")
total := price.Mul(multiplier)
```

## Basic Operations

### Creation and Initialization

```go
// From string (PREFERRED for literals)
price := decimal.RequireFromString("123.456789")

// From int
quantity := decimal.NewFromInt(100)

// From float (ONLY when interfacing with external APIs)
// Always validate precision after conversion
apiPrice := decimal.NewFromFloat(apiResponse.Price)
if apiPrice.Exponent() < -8 {
    // Handle precision loss

1â†’// Package math provides mathematical utilities for decimal operations used throughout the trading system.
     2â†’// It includes functions for complex calculations like square roots that aren't provided by the decimal library.
     3â†’package math
     4â†’
     5â†’import (
     6â†’	"github.com/shopspring/decimal"
     7â†’)
     8â†’
     9â†’// DecimalSqrt calculates the square root of a decimal number using Newton's method
    10â†’// with configurable precision iterations
    11â†’func DecimalSqrt(d decimal.Decimal) decimal.Decimal {
    12â†’	// Handle special cases
    13â†’	if d.IsZero() {
    14â†’		return decimal.Zero
    15â†’	}
    16â†’	if d.IsNegative() {
    17â†’		// Return zero for negative numbers (could panic or return error instead)
    18â†’		return decimal.Zero
    19â†’	}
    20â†’	
    21â†’	// Use Newton's method: x_{n+1} = (x_n + d/x_n) / 2
    22â†’	// Start with a reasonable initial guess
    23â†’	x := d.Div(decimal.NewFromInt(2))
    24â†’	two := decimal.NewFromInt(2)
    25â†’	
    26â†’	// Precision threshold - stop when change is less than this
    27â†’	epsilon := decimal.NewFromFloat(1e-15)
    28â†’	
    29â†’	// Maximum iterations to prevent infinite loops
    30â†’	maxIterations := 50
    31â†’	
    32â†’	for i := 0; i < maxIterations; i++ {
    33â†’		// Calculate next approximation
    34â†’		nextX := x.Add(d.Div(x)).Div(two)
    35â†’		
    36â†’		// Check if we've converged
    37â†’		diff := nextX.Sub(x).Abs()
    38â†’		if diff.LessThan(epsilon) {
    39â†’			return nextX
    40â†’		}
    41â†’		
    42â†’		x = nextX
    43â†’	}
    44â†’	
    45â†’	return x
    46â†’}
    47â†’
    48â†’// DecimalStdDev calculates the standard deviation of a slice of decimals
    49â†’// maintaining decimal precision throughout
    50â†’func DecimalStdDev(values []decimal.Decimal) decimal.Decimal {
    51â†’	if len(values) < 2 {
    52â†’		return decimal.Zero
    53â†’	}
    54â†’	
    55â†’	// Calculate mean
    56â†’	sum := decimal.Zero
    57â†’	for _, v := range values {
    58â†’		sum = sum.Add(v)
    59â†’	}
    60â†’	mean := sum.Div(decimal.NewFromInt(int64(len(values))))
    61â†’	
    62â†’	// Calculate variance
    63â†’	varianceSum := decimal.Zero
    64â†’	for _, v := range values {
    65â†’		diff := v.Sub(mean)
    66â†’		varianceSum = varianceSum.Add(diff.Pow(decimal.NewFromInt(2)))
    67â†’	}
    68â†’	variance := varianceSum.Div(decimal.NewFromInt(int64(len(values) - 1)))
    69â†’	
    70â†’	// Return standard deviation
    71â†’	return DecimalSqrt(variance)
    72â†’}
    73â†’
    74â†’// DecimalDownsideDeviation calculates the downside deviation (semi-deviation)
    75â†’// for risk metrics like Sortino ratio
    76â†’func DecimalDownsideDeviation(returns []decimal.Decimal, target decimal.Decimal) decimal.Decimal {
    77â†’	if len(returns) < 2 {
    78â†’		return decimal.Zero
    79â†’	}
    80â†’	
    81â†’	// Calculate downside variance (only negative deviations)
    82â†’	downsideSum := decimal.Zero
    83â†’	downsideCount := 0
    84â†’	
    85â†’	for _, ret := range returns {
    86â†’		if ret.LessThan(target) {
    87â†’			diff := target.Sub(ret)
    88â†’			downsideSum = downsideSum.Add(diff.Pow(decimal.NewFromInt(2)))
    89â†’			downsideCount++
    90â†’		}
    91â†’	}
    92â†’	
    93â†’	if downsideCount < 2 {
    94â†’		return decimal.Zero
    95â†’	}
    96â†’	
    97â†’	downsideVariance := downsideSum.Div(decimal.NewFromInt(int64(downsideCount - 1)))
    98â†’	return DecimalSqrt(downsideVariance)
    99â†’}

## Documentation Inaccuracies and Inconsistencies Report

After reviewing the documentation files in `/back/.docs/code` against the actual codebase implementation, here are the identified issues:

### 1. **Module Path Mismatch**
- **File**: Multiple documentation files reference `bigmeanie/` imports

content.content:
1â†’# Go Packages - Package Design and Management
     2â†’
     3â†’## Table of Contents
     4â†’1. [Package Design](#package-design)
     5â†’2. [API Design](#api-design)
     6â†’3. [Internal Packages](#internal-packages)
     7â†’4. [Versioning](#versioning)
     8â†’5. [Documentation](#documentation)
     9â†’6. [Module Management](#module-management)
    10â†’7. [Dependencies](#dependencies)
    11â†’8. [Package Patterns](#package-patterns)
    12â†’9. [Publishing Packages](#publishing-packages)
    13â†’10. [Best Practices](#best-practices)
    14â†’
    15â†’## Package Design
    16â†’
    17â†’### Package Structure
    18â†’```go
    19â†’// Package naming conventions
    20â†’package user        // Good: singular, lowercase
    21â†’package users       // Bad: plural
    22â†’package userMgmt    // Bad: camelCase
    23â†’package user_mgmt   // Bad: underscore
    24â†’
    25â†’// Package organization
    26â†’myproject/
    27â†’â”œâ”€â”€ cmd/
    28â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ api/
    29â†’â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ main.go
    30â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ worker/
    31â†’â”‚       â””â”€â”€ main.go
    32â†’â”œâ”€â”€ internal/
    33â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ auth/
    34â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ database/
    35â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ models/
    36â†’â”œâ”€â”€ pkg/
    37â†’â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ client/
    38â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ utils/
    39â†’â”œâ”€â”€ api/
    40â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ v1/
    41â†’â”œâ”€â”€ docs/
    42â†’â”œâ”€â”€ scripts/
    43â†’â”œâ”€â”€ go.mod
    44â†’â””â”€â”€ go.sum
    45â†’
    46â†’// Package declaration with documentation
    47â†’// Package user provides user management functionality.
    48â†’// It includes user creation, authentication, and profile management.
    49â†’package user
    50â†’
    51â†’// Import grouping
    52â†’import (
    53â†’    // Standard library
    54â†’    "context"
    55â†’    "fmt"
    56â†’    "time"
    57â†’    
    58â†’    // Third-party packages
    59â†’    "github.com/google/uuid"
    60â†’    "golang.org/x/crypto/bcrypt"
    61â†’    
    62â†’    // Internal packages
    63â†’    "myproject/internal/database"
    64â†’    "myproject/pkg/errors"
    65â†’)
    66â†’```
    67â†’
    68â†’### Package Cohesion
    69â†’```go
    70â†’// High cohesion - related functionality
    71â†’package auth
    72â†’
    73â†’type Authenticator interface {
    74â†’    Authenticate(credentials Credentials) (*User, error)
    75â†’    Refresh(token string) (*Token, error)
    76â†’    Revoke(token string) error
    77â†’}
    78â†’
    79â†’type Credentials struct {
    80â†’    Username string
    81â†’    Password string
    82â†’}
    83â†’
    84â†’type Token struct {
    85â†’    AccessToken  string
    86â†’    RefreshToken string
    87â†’    ExpiresAt    time.Time
    88â†’}
    89â†’
    90â†’type User struct {
    91â†’    ID       string
    92â†’    Username string
    93â†’    Roles    []string
    94â†’}
    95â†’
    96â†’// Low cohesion - avoid generic packages
    97â†’package utils  // Bad: too generic
    98â†’
    99â†’func HashPassword(password string) string { }
   100â†’func SendEmail(to, subject, body string) error { }
   101â†’func ParseJSON(data []byte) (interface{}, error) { }
   102â†’func GenerateID() string { }
   103â†’
   104â†’// Better: specific packages
   105â†’package password
   106â†’package email
   107â†’package json
   108â†’package id
   109â†’```
   110â†’
   111â†’### Package Dependencies
   112â†’```go
   113â†’// Minimize dependencies
   114â†’package user
   115â†’
   116â†’// Good: depends only on necessary packages
   117â†’import (
   118â†’    "context"
   119â†’    "myproject/internal/database"
   120â†’)
   121â†’
   122â†’// Bad: too many dependencies
   123â†’import (
   124â†’    "myproject/internal/auth"
   125â†’    "myproject/internal/email"
   126â†’    "myproject/internal/sms"
   127â†’    "myproject/internal/push"
   128â†’    "myproject/internal/analytics"
   129â†’    // ... many more
   130â†’)
   131â†’
   132â†’// Dependency inversion
   133â†’package service
   134â†’
   135â†’// Define interface in the consumer package
   136â†’type UserRepository interface {
   137â†’    GetUser(ctx context.Context, id string) (*User, error)
   138â†’    SaveUser(ctx context.Context, user *User) error
   139â†’}
   140â†’
   141â†’type UserService struct {
   142â†’    repo UserRepository  // Depend on interface
   143â†’}
   144â†’
   145â†’// Implementation in another package
   146â†’package database
   147â†’
   148â†’type PostgresUserRepository struct {
   149â†’    db *sql.DB
   150â†’}
   151â†’
   152â†’func (r *PostgresUserRepository) GetUser(ctx context.Context, id string) (*User, error) {
   153â†’    // Implementation
   154â†’}
   155â†’
   156â†’// Avoid circular dependencies
   157â†’package a
   158â†’import "b"  // a depends on b
   159â†’
   160â†’package b
   161â†’import "a"  // b depends on a - CIRCULAR!
   162â†’
   163â†’// Solution: introduce interface or third package
   164â†’package c
   165â†’type SharedInterface interface { }
   166â†’
   167â†’package a
   168â†’import "c"
   169â†’
   170â†’package b
   171â†’import "c"
   172â†’```
   173â†’
   174â†’## API Design
   175â†’
   176â†’### Exported vs Unexported
   177â†’```go
   178â†’package mypackage
   179â†’
   180â†’// Exported (public) - capitalized
   181â†’type Client struct {
   182â†’    Endpoint string
   183â†’    Timeout  time.Duration
   184â†’}
   185â†’
   186â†’func NewClient(endpoint string) *Client {
   187â†’    return &Client{
   188â†’        Endpoint: endpoint,
   189â†’        Timeout:  30 * time.Second,
   190â†’    }
   191â†’}
   192â†’
   193â†’func (c *Client) Request(ctx context.Context, data []byte) (*Response, error) {
   194â†’    return c.doRequest(ctx, data)
   195â†’}
   196â†’
   197â†’// Unexported (private) - lowercase
   198â†’type config struct {
   199â†’    retryCount int
   200â†’    backoff    time.Duration
   201â†’}
   202â†’
   203â†’func (c *Client) doRequest(ctx context.Context, data []byte) (*Response, error) {
   204â†’    // Internal implementation
   205â†’}
   206â†’
   207â†’// Partially exported struct
   208â†’type Response struct {
   209â†’    Status  int         // Exported
   210â†’    Data    []byte      // Exported
   211â†’    headers http.Header // Unexported
   212â†’}
   213â†’```
   214â†’
   215â†’### API Stability
   216â†’```go
   217â†’// Stable API design
   218â†’package stable
   219â†’
   220â†’// Use interfaces for flexibility
   221â†’type Store interface {
   222â†’    Get(key string) ([]byte, error)
   223â†’    Set(key string, value []byte) error
   224â†’    Delete(key string) error
   225â†’}
   226â†’
   227â†’// Options pattern for extensibility
   228â†’type ClientOptions struct {
   229â†’    Timeout     time.Duration
   230â†’    MaxRetries  int
   231â†’    Headers     map[string]string
   232â†’    // Can add new fields without breaking
   233â†’}
   234â†’
   235â†’func NewClient(opts ClientOptions) *Client {
   236â†’    // Set defaults for zero values
   237â†’    if opts.Timeout == 0 {
   238â†’        opts.Timeout = 30 * time.Second
   239â†’    }
   240â†’    if opts.MaxRetries == 0 {
   241â†’        opts.MaxRetries = 3
   242â†’    }
   243â†’    
   244â†’    return &Client{opts: opts}
   245â†’}
   246â†’
   247â†’// Functional options for better API
   248â†’type Option func(*Client)
   249â†’
   250â†’func WithTimeout(d time.Duration) Option {
   251â†’    return func(c *Client) {
   252â†’        c.timeout = d
   253â†’    }
   254â†’}
   255â†’
   256â†’func WithRetries(n int) Option {
   257â†’    return func(c *Client) {
   258â†’        c.maxRetries = n
   259â†’    }
   260â†’}
   261â†’
   262â†’func NewClientWithOptions(opts ...Option) *Client {
   263â†’    c := &Client{
   264â†’        timeout:    30 * time.Second,
   265â†’        maxRetries: 3,
   266â†’    }
   267â†’    
   268â†’    for _, opt := range opts {
   269â†’        opt(c)
   270â†’    }
   271â†’    
   272â†’    return c
   273â†’}
   274â†’
   275â†’// Deprecation
   276â†’// Deprecated: Use NewClientWithOptions instead.
   277â†’func NewClientOld(endpoint string) *Client {
   278â†’    return NewClientWithOptions(WithEndpoint(endpoint))
   279â†’}
   280â†’```

   282â†’### Error Design
   283â†’```go
   284â†’package mypackage
   285â†’
   286â†’// Sentinel errors
   287â†’var (
   288â†’    ErrNotFound      = errors.New("not found")
   289â†’    ErrUnauthorized  = errors.New("unauthorized")
   290â†’    ErrInvalidInput  = errors.New("invalid input")
   291â†’)
   292â†’
   293â†’// Error types
   294â†’type ValidationError struct {
   295â†’    Field   string
   296â†’    Message string
   297â†’}
   298â†’
   299â†’func (e ValidationError) Error() string {
   300â†’    return fmt.Sprintf("validation error on field %s: %s", e.Field, e.Message)
   301â†’}
   302â†’
   303â†’// Error wrapping
   304â†’func GetUser(id string) (*User, error) {
   305â†’    user, err := db.Query(id)
   306â†’    if err != nil {
   307â†’        if errors.Is(err, sql.ErrNoRows) {
   308â†’            return nil, ErrNotFound
   309â†’        }
   310â†’        return nil, fmt.Errorf("failed to get user %s: %w", id, err)
   311â†’    }
   312â†’    return user, nil
   313â†’}
   314â†’
   315â†’// Custom error checking
   316â†’func IsNotFound(err error) bool {
   317â†’    return errors.Is(err, ErrNotFound)
   318â†’}
   319â†’
   320â†’func IsValidation(err error) bool {
   321â†’    var validationErr ValidationError
   322â†’    return errors.As(err, &validationErr)
   323â†’}
   324â†’```

   416â†’## Versioning
   417â†’
   418â†’### Semantic Versioning
   419â†’```go
   420â†’// go.mod versioning
   421â†’module github.com/user/myproject
   422â†’
   423â†’go 1.21
   424â†’
   425â†’require (
   426â†’    github.com/some/dep v1.2.3   // Exact version
   427â†’    github.com/other/dep v2.0.0+incompatible
   428â†’    github.com/new/dep/v2 v2.1.0 // Major version in path
   429â†’)
   430â†’
   431â†’// Version tags
   432â†’// git tag v1.0.0
   433â†’// git tag v1.0.1
   434â†’// git tag v1.1.0
   435â†’// git tag v2.0.0
   436â†’
   437â†’// Major version changes (v2+)
   438â†’// Update module path
   439â†’module github.com/user/myproject/v2
   440â†’
   441â†’// Import with version
   442â†’import "github.com/user/myproject/v2/pkg/client"
   443â†’
   444â†’// Maintaining multiple versions
   445â†’myproject/
   446â†’â”œâ”€â”€ go.mod          // module github.com/user/myproject
   447â†’â””â”€â”€ v2/
   448â†’    â””â”€â”€ go.mod      // module github.com/user/myproject/v2
   449â†’
   450â†’// Version constraints
   451â†’require (
   452â†’    github.com/some/dep v1.2.3     // Exact
   453â†’    github.com/some/dep v1.2.x     // Patch updates
   454â†’    github.com/some/dep v1.x.x     // Minor updates
   455â†’    github.com/some/dep latest     // Latest
   456â†’    github.com/some/dep master     // Branch
   457â†’)
   458â†’```

   511â†’### Package Documentation
   512â†’```go
   513â†’// Package documentation (doc.go)
   514â†’/*
   515â†’Package user provides user management functionality for the application.
   516â†’
   517â†’The package includes:
   518â†’  - User CRUD operations
   519â†’  - Authentication and authorization
   520â†’  - Profile management
   521â†’  - Password reset functionality
   522â†’
   523â†’Basic usage:
   524â†’
   525â†’	service := user.NewService(db)
   526â†’	
   527â†’	// Create user
   528â†’	u, err := service.Create(ctx, user.CreateRequest{
   529â†’		Email:    "user@example.com",
   530â†’		Password: "secure123",
   531â†’	})
   532â†’	
   533â†’	// Authenticate
   534â†’	token, err := service.Authenticate(ctx, email, password)
   535â†’
   536â†’For more examples, see the examples directory.
   537â†’*/
   538â†’package user
   539â†’
   540â†’// Type documentation
   541â†’// User represents a system user.
   542â†’// Users can have multiple roles and permissions.
   543â†’type User struct {
   544â†’    // ID is the unique identifier for the user.
   545â†’    ID string
   546â†’    
   547â†’    // Email is the user's email address.
   548â†’    // It must be unique across all users.
   549â†’    Email string
   550â†’    
   551â†’    // CreatedAt is when the user was created.
   552â†’    CreatedAt time.Time
   553â†’    
   554â†’    // Roles contains the user's assigned roles.
   555â†’    Roles []Role
   556â†’}
   557â†’
   558â†’// Method documentation
   559â†’// Create creates a new user with the given request.
   560â†’// It returns an error if the email already exists or validation fails.
   561â†’//
   562â†’// Example:
   563â†’//
   564â†’//	user, err := service.Create(ctx, CreateRequest{
   565â†’//	    Email:    "user@example.com",
   566â†’//	    Password: "secure123",
   567â†’//	})
   568â†’//	if err != nil {
   569â†’//	    log.Fatal(err)
   570â†’//	}
   571â†’func (s *Service) Create(ctx context.Context, req CreateRequest) (*User, error) {
   572â†’    // Implementation
   573â†’}
   574â†’
   575â†’// Deprecated documentation
   576â†’// Deprecated: Use CreateWithOptions instead.
   577â†’// This function will be removed in v2.0.0.
   578â†’func (s *Service) CreateOld(email, password string) (*User, error) {
   579â†’    return s.CreateWithOptions(CreateOptions{
   580â†’        Email:    email,
   581â†’        Password: password,
   582â†’    })
   583â†’}
   584â†’```

   739â†’## Dependencies
   740â†’
   741â†’### Managing Dependencies
   742â†’```go
   743â†’// Adding dependencies
   744â†’// go get github.com/pkg/errors
   745â†’// go get github.com/pkg/errors@v0.9.1
   746â†’// go get github.com/pkg/errors@latest
   747â†’// go get github.com/pkg/errors@master
   748â†’
   749â†’// Updating dependencies
   750â†’// go get -u                    - Update all
   751â†’// go get -u ./...             - Update all in module
   752â†’// go get -u=patch ./...       - Update patch versions
   753â†’// go get -u github.com/pkg/...  - Update specific package
   754â†’
   755â†’// Removing dependencies
   756â†’// go mod tidy                  - Remove unused
   757â†’
   758â†’// Vendoring
   759â†’// go mod vendor               - Create vendor/
   760â†’// go build -mod=vendor        - Build with vendor/
   761â†’
   762â†’// Dependency analysis
   763â†’import "golang.org/x/mod/modfile"
   764â†’
   765â†’func analyzeDependencies() {
   766â†’    data, _ := os.ReadFile("go.mod")
   767â†’    file, _ := modfile.Parse("go.mod", data, nil)
   768â†’    
   769â†’    for _, req := range file.Require {
   770â†’        fmt.Printf("%s: %s\n", req.Mod.Path, req.Mod.Version)
   771â†’    }
   772â†’}
   773â†’
   774â†’// Private dependencies
   775â†’// Set GOPRIVATE environment variable
   776â†’// GOPRIVATE=github.com/company/*
   777â†’
   778â†’// Use .netrc for authentication
   779â†’// machine github.com
   780â†’// login username
   781â†’// password token
   782â†’
   783â†’// Or use SSH
   784â†’// git config --global url."git@github.com:".insteadOf "https://github.com/"
   785â†’```
   786â†’
   787â†’### Dependency Injection
   788â†’```go
   789â†’// Constructor injection
   790â†’type Service struct {
   791â†’    db     Database
   792â†’    cache  Cache
   793â†’    logger Logger
   794â†’}
   795â†’
   796â†’func NewService(db Database, cache Cache, logger Logger) *Service {
   797â†’    return &Service{
   798â†’        db:     db,
   799â†’        cache:  cache,
   800â†’        logger: logger,
   801â†’    }
   802â†’}
   803â†’
   804â†’// Interface injection
   805â†’type Database interface {
   806â†’    Query(string) ([]Row, error)
   807â†’}
   808â†’
   809â†’type Cache interface {
   810â†’    Get(string) (interface{}, bool)
   811â†’    Set(string, interface{})
   812â†’}
   813â†’
   814â†’// Wire for dependency injection
   815â†’//go:build wireinject
   816â†’
   817â†’import "github.com/google/wire"
   818â†’
   819â†’func InitializeService() (*Service, error) {
   820â†’    wire.Build(
   821â†’        NewDatabase,
   822â†’        NewCache,
   823â†’        NewLogger,
   824â†’        NewService,
   825â†’    )
   826â†’    return nil, nil
   827â†’}
   828â†’
   829â†’// Provider sets
   830â†’var BasicSet = wire.NewSet(
   831â†’    NewDatabase,
   832â†’    NewCache,
   833â†’    NewLogger,
   834â†’)

   842â†’
   843â†’## Package Patterns
   844â†’
   845â†’### Plugin Pattern
   846â†’```go
   847â†’// Plugin interface
   848â†’package plugin
   849â†’
   850â†’type Plugin interface {
   851â†’    Name() string
   852â†’    Initialize(config map[string]interface{}) error
   853â†’    Execute(context.Context, interface{}) (interface{}, error)
   854â†’    Shutdown() error
   855â†’}
   856â†’
   857â†’// Registry
   858â†’type Registry struct {
   859â†’    mu      sync.RWMutex
   860â†’    plugins map[string]Plugin
   861â†’}
   862â†’
   863â†’func (r *Registry) Register(p Plugin) {
   864â†’    r.mu.Lock()
   865â†’    defer r.mu.Unlock()
   866â†’    r.plugins[p.Name()] = p
   867â†’}
   868â†’
   869â†’func (r *Registry) Get(name string) (Plugin, bool) {
   870â†’    r.mu.RLock()
   871â†’    defer r.mu.RUnlock()
   872â†’    p, ok := r.plugins[name]
   873â†’    return p, ok
   874â†’}
   875â†’
   876â†’// Plugin implementation
   877â†’package myplugin
   878â†’
   879â†’type MyPlugin struct {
   880â†’    config map[string]interface{}
   881â†’}
   882â†’
   883â†’func (p *MyPlugin) Name() string {
   884â†’    return "my-plugin"
   885â†’}
   886â†’
   887â†’func (p *MyPlugin) Initialize(config map[string]interface{}) error {
   888â†’    p.config = config
   889â†’    return nil
   890â†’}
   891â†’
   892â†’// Auto-registration
   893â†’func init() {
   894â†’    plugin.DefaultRegistry.Register(&MyPlugin{})
   895â†’}
   896â†’```
   897â†’
   898â†’### Provider Pattern
   899â†’```go
   900â†’// Provider interface
   901â†’package provider
   902â†’
   903â†’type StorageProvider interface {
   904â†’    Read(key string) ([]byte, error)
   905â†’    Write(key string, data []byte) error
   906â†’    Delete(key string) error
   907â†’}
   908â†’
   909â†’// Factory
   910â†’type ProviderFactory func(config Config) (StorageProvider, error)
   911â†’
   912â†’var providers = make(map[string]ProviderFactory)
   913â†’
   914â†’func Register(name string, factory ProviderFactory) {
   915â†’    providers[name] = factory
   916â†’}
   917â†’
   918â†’func New(name string, config Config) (StorageProvider, error) {
   919â†’    factory, ok := providers[name]
   920â†’    if !ok {
   921â†’        return nil, fmt.Errorf("unknown provider: %s", name)
   922â†’    }
   923â†’    return factory(config)
   924â†’}
   925â†’
   926â†’// S3 provider
   927â†’package s3
   928â†’
   929â†’func init() {
   930â†’    provider.Register("s3", NewS3Provider)
   931â†’}
   932â†’
   933â†’func NewS3Provider(config provider.Config) (provider.StorageProvider, error) {
   934â†’    return &S3Provider{
   935â†’        bucket: config.Get("bucket"),
   936â†’        region: config.Get("region"),
   937â†’    }, nil
   938â†’}
   939â†’```
   940â†’
   941â†’### Repository Pattern
   942â†’```go
   943â†’package repository
   944â†’
   945â†’// Generic repository interface
   946â†’type Repository[T any] interface {
   947â†’    Find(ctx context.Context, id string) (*T, error)
   948â†’    FindAll(ctx context.Context) ([]*T, error)
   949â†’    Create(ctx context.Context, entity *T) error
   950â†’    Update(ctx context.Context, entity *T) error
   951â†’    Delete(ctx context.Context, id string) error
   952â†’}
   953â†’
   954â†’// Specific implementation
   955â†’type UserRepository interface {
   956â†’    Repository[User]
   957â†’    FindByEmail(ctx context.Context, email string) (*User, error)
   958â†’    FindByRole(ctx context.Context, role string) ([]*User, error)
   959â†’}
   960â†’
   961â†’// SQL implementation
   962â†’type sqlUserRepository struct {
   963â†’    db *sql.DB
   964â†’}
   965â†’
   966â†’func NewSQLUserRepository(db *sql.DB) UserRepository {
   967â†’    return &sqlUserRepository{db: db}
   968â†’}
   969â†’
   970â†’func (r *sqlUserRepository) Find(ctx context.Context, id string) (*User, error) {
   971â†’    query := `SELECT id, email, created_at FROM users WHERE id = $1`
   972â†’    // Implementation
   973â†’}
   974â†’
   975â†’// MongoDB implementation
   976â†’type mongoUserRepository struct {

   978â†’}
   979â†’
   980â†’func NewMongoUserRepository(db *mongo.Database) UserRepository {
   981â†’    return &mongoUserRepository{
   982â†’        collection: db.Collection("users"),
   983â†’    }
   984â†’}
   985â†’```

   987â†’## Publishing Packages

   989â†’### Preparing for Publication
   990â†’```go
   991â†’// 1. Choose a good name

   996â†’// 2. Create comprehensive documentation

  1003â†’// 3. Add examples
  1004â†’examples/
  1005â†’â”œâ”€â”€ basic/

  1033â†’
  1034â†’### Publishing Process
  1035â†’```bash
  1036â†’# 1. Tag version

  1038â†’git push origin v1.0.0
  1039â†’
  1040â†’# 2. The package is automatically available

  1057â†’### Package Maintenance
  1058â†’```go
  1059â†’// Deprecation process
  1060â†’// 1. Mark as deprecated in documentation

  1064â†’
  1065â†’// 2. Log deprecation warnings

  1068â†’    // Existing implementation
  1069â†’}

  1071â†’// 3. Provide migration guide

  1073â†’Migration Guide from v1 to v2:

  1075â†’1. Replace OldFunction() with NewFunction()
  1076â†’2. Update Client struct initialization:

  1081â†’   New: import "github.com/user/package/v2"
  1082â†’*/
  1083â†’
  1084â†’// Version compatibility

  1088â†’import (
  1089â†’    v1 "mypackage/v1"

  1091â†’)
  1092â†’
  1093â†’func MigrateV1ToV2(old *v1.Config) *v2.Config {
  1094â†’    return &v2.Config{
  1095â†’        // Map old fields to new
  1096â†’    }
  1097â†’}
  1098â†’```

  1100â†’## Best Practices
  1101â†’
  1102â†’### Package Design Principles
  1103â†’```go
  1104â†’// 1. Single Responsibility
  1105â†’// Each package should have one clear purpose
  1106â†’
  1107â†’// 2. Minimal Public API
  1108â†’// Export only what's necessary
  1109â†’package mypackage
  1110â†’
  1111â†’type Client struct{} // Exported
  1112â†’
  1113â†’type implementation struct{} // Unexported
  1114â†’
  1115â†’// 3. Accept Interfaces, Return Structs

  1117â†’    // Accept interface for flexibility
  1118â†’    // Return concrete type for clarity
  1119â†’}
  1120â†’
  1121â†’// 4. Avoid Init Functions
  1122â†’// Bad: Side effects on import
  1123â†’func init() {
  1124â†’    database.Connect() // Side effect!
  1125â†’}
  1126â†’
  1127â†’// Good: Explicit initialization
  1128â†’func Initialize() error {
  1129â†’    return database.Connect()
  1130â†’}
  1131â†’
  1132â†’// 5. No Circular Dependencies
  1133â†’// Use interfaces to break cycles

  1135â†’// 6. Consistent Naming

  1137â†’// Avoid stuttering: user.User not user.UserUser
  1138â†’

  1141â†’// Major.Minor.Patch

  1146â†’
  1147â†’// 9. Clear Documentation
  1148â†’// Document all exports
  1149â†’// Provide examples
  1150â†’
  1151â†’// 10. Minimal Dependencies
  1152â†’// Avoid unnecessary dependencies
  1153â†’// Vendor or ensure stability
  1154â†’```
  1155â†’
  1156â†’### Common Pitfalls
  1157â†’```go
  1158â†’// 1. Overusing init()

  1161â†’// 2. God packages

  1190â†’
  1191â†’1. **Design cohesive packages** - Single, clear purpose
  1192â†’2. **Minimize public API** - Export only what's necessary

1â†’// Package decimal_math provides mathematical utilities for decimal operations used throughout the trading system.
     2â†’// It includes functions for complex calculations like square roots that aren't provided by the decimal library.
     3â†’package decimal_math
     4â†’
     5â†’import (
     6â†’	"github.com/shopspring/decimal"
     7â†’)
     8â†’
     9â†’// DecimalSqrt calculates the square root of a decimal number using Newton's method
    10â†’// with configurable precision iterations
    11â†’func DecimalSqrt(d decimal.Decimal) decimal.Decimal {
    12â†’	// Handle special cases
    13â†’	if d.IsZero() {
    14â†’		return decimal.Zero
    15â†’	}
    16â†’	if d.IsNegative() {
    17â†’		// Return zero for negative numbers (could panic or return error instead)
    18â†’		return decimal.Zero
    19â†’	}
    20â†’	
    21â†’	// Use Newton's method: x_{n+1} = (x_n + d/x_n) / 2
    22â†’	// Start with a reasonable initial guess
    23â†’	x := d.Div(decimal.NewFromInt(2))
    24â†’	two := decimal.NewFromInt(2)
    25â†’	
    26â†’	// Precision threshold - stop when change is less than this
    27â†’	epsilon := decimal.NewFromFloat(1e-15)
    28â†’	
    29â†’	// Maximum iterations to prevent infinite loops
    30â†’	maxIterations := 50
    31â†’	
    32â†’	for i := 0; i < maxIterations; i++ {
    33â†’		// Calculate next approximation
    34â†’		nextX := x.Add(d.Div(x)).Div(two)
    35â†’		
    36â†’		// Check if we've converged
    37â†’		diff := nextX.Sub(x).Abs()
    38â†’		if diff.LessThan(epsilon) {
    39â†’			return nextX
    40â†’		}
    41â†’		
    42â†’		x = nextX
    43â†’	}
    44â†’	
    45â†’	return x
    46â†’}
    47â†’
    48â†’// DecimalStdDev calculates the standard deviation of a slice of decimals
    49â†’// maintaining decimal precision throughout
    50â†’func DecimalStdDev(values []decimal.Decimal) decimal.Decimal {
    51â†’	if len(values) < 2 {
    52â†’		return decimal.Zero
    53â†’	}
    54â†’	
    55â†’	// Calculate mean
    56â†’	sum := decimal.Zero
    57â†’	for _, v := range values {
    58â†’		sum = sum.Add(v)
    59â†’	}
    60â†’	mean := sum.Div(decimal.NewFromInt(int64(len(values))))
    61â†’	
    62â†’	// Calculate variance
    63â†’	varianceSum := decimal.Zero
    64â†’	for _, v := range values {
    65â†’		diff := v.Sub(mean)
    66â†’		varianceSum = varianceSum.Add(diff.Pow(decimal.NewFromInt(2)))
    67â†’	}
    68â†’	variance := varianceSum.Div(decimal.NewFromInt(int64(len(values) - 1)))
    69â†’	
    70â†’	// Return standard deviation
    71â†’	return DecimalSqrt(variance)
    72â†’}
    73â†’
    74â†’// DecimalDownsideDeviation calculates the downside deviation (semi-deviation)
    75â†’// for risk metrics like Sortino ratio
    76â†’func DecimalDownsideDeviation(returns []decimal.Decimal, target decimal.Decimal) decimal.Decimal {
    77â†’	if len(returns) < 2 {
    78â†’		return decimal.Zero
    79â†’	}
    80â†’	
    81â†’	// Calculate downside variance (only negative deviations)
    82â†’	downsideSum := decimal.Zero
    83â†’	downsideCount := 0
    84â†’	
    85â†’	for _, ret := range returns {
    86â†’		if ret.LessThan(target) {
    87â†’			diff := target.Sub(ret)
    88â†’			downsideSum = downsideSum.Add(diff.Pow(decimal.NewFromInt(2)))
    89â†’			downsideCount++
    90â†’		}
    91â†’	}
    92â†’	
    93â†’	if downsideCount < 2 {
    94â†’		return decimal.Zero
    95â†’	}
    96â†’	
    97â†’	downsideVariance := downsideSum.Div(decimal.NewFromInt(int64(downsideCount - 1)))
    98â†’	return DecimalSqrt(downsideVariance)
    99â†’}

#!/bin/bash

cd /home/aural/Code/bigmeanie/back

find pkg -type f -name "*.go" | grep -v "_test.go" | while read file; do
    dir=$(dirname "$file")
    expected_pkg=$(basename "$dir")
    actual_pkg=$(grep "^package " "$file" | head -1 | awk '{print $2}')

        echo "MISMATCH: $file"

        echo "  Package:   $actual_pkg"
        echo
    fi
done

   314â†’
   315â†’    // External dependencies
   316â†’    "github.com/shopspring/decimal"
   317â†’
   318â†’    // Internal packages
   319â†’    "bigmeanie/internal/engine"
   320â†’    "bigmeanie/pkg/indicators"
   321â†’)
   322â†’
   323â†’// Never use relative imports
   324â†’// BAD:  import "../engine"
   325â†’// GOOD: import "bigmeanie/internal/engine"
   326â†’```
   327â†’
   328â†’## Code Organization
   329â†’
   330â†’### Interface Design
   331â†’
   332â†’```go
   333â†’// Small, focused interfaces
   334â†’type Trader interface {
   335â†’    Trade(ctx context.Context, signal Signal) error
   336â†’}
   337â†’
   338â†’// Not large, kitchen-sink interfaces
   339â†’type BadTrader interface {
   340â†’    Trade() error
   341â†’    GetBalance() decimal.Decimal
   342â†’    GetHistory() []Trade
   343â†’    Configure(Config) error
   344â†’    // ... 20 more methods - NO!
   345â†’}
   346â†’
   347â†’// Compose interfaces when needed
   348â†’type FullTrader interface {
   349â†’    Trader
   350â†’    Backtester
   351â†’    Reporter
   352â†’}
   353â†’```
   354â†’
   355â†’### Error Handling
   356â†’
   357â†’```go
   358â†’// Always wrap errors with context
   359â†’if err != nil {
   360â†’    return fmt.Errorf("engine.Start: %w", err)
   361â†’}
   362â†’
   363â†’// Define sentinel errors
   364â†’var (
   365â†’    ErrInsufficientFunds = errors.New("insufficient funds")
   366â†’    ErrOrderTooSmall     = errors.New("order below minimum")
   367â†’    ErrExchangeDown      = errors.New("exchange unavailable")
   368â†’)
   369â†’
   370â†’// Use errors.Is for checking
   371â†’if errors.Is(err, ErrInsufficientFunds) {
   372â†’    // Handle specific error
   373â†’}
   374â†’```
   375â†’
   376â†’### Concurrency Patterns
   377â†’
   378â†’```go
   379â†’// Always use context for cancellation
   380â†’func (e *Engine) Run(ctx context.Context) error {
   381â†’    for {
   382â†’        select {
   383â†’        case <-ctx.Done():
   384â†’            return ctx.Err()
   385â†’        case signal := <-e.signals:
   386â†’            e.process(signal)
   387â†’        }
   388â†’    }
   389â†’}
   390â†’
   391â†’// Protect shared state
   392â†’type Portfolio struct {
   393â†’    mu       sync.RWMutex
   394â†’    balances map[string]decimal.Decimal
   395â†’}
   396â†’
   397â†’func (p *Portfolio) Balance(asset string) decimal.Decimal {
   398â†’    p.mu.RLock()
   399â†’    defer p.mu.RUnlock()
   400â†’    return p.balances[asset]
   401â†’}
   402â†’```
   403â†’
   404â†’## Testing Standards
   405â†’
   406â†’### Test Organization
   407â†’
   408â†’```go
   409â†’// Table-driven tests always
   410â†’func TestCalcSR(t *testing.T) {
   411â†’    tests := []struct {
   412â†’        name string
   413â†’        data []decimal.Decimal
   414â†’        want []Level
   415â†’    }{
   416â†’        {
   417â†’            name: "basic support",
   418â†’            data: []decimal.Decimal{...},
   419â†’            want: []Level{...},
   420â†’        },
   421â†’    }
   422â†’
   423â†’    for _, tt := range tests {
   424â†’        t.Run(tt.name, func(t *testing.T) {
   425â†’            got := CalcSR(tt.data)
   426â†’            require.Equal(t, tt.want, got)
   427â†’        })
   428â†’    }
   429â†’}
   430â†’
   431â†’// NEVER use t.Skip()
   432â†’// BAD:
   433â†’func TestBrokenFeature(t *testing.T) {
   434â†’    t.Skip("Fix later")  // NEVER
   435â†’}
   436â†’
   437â†’// GOOD: Fix it or delete it
   438â†’```
   439â†’
   440â†’### Test Coverage
   441â†’
   442â†’```go
   443â†’// Test edge cases
   444â†’func TestDivision(t *testing.T) {
   445â†’    // Test zero division
   446â†’    _, err := Divide(decimal.NewFromInt(1), decimal.Zero)
   447â†’    require.Error(t, err)
   448â†’
   449â†’    // Test negative values
   450â†’    result := Divide(decimal.NewFromInt(-10), decimal.NewFromInt(2))
   451â†’    require.Equal(t, decimal.NewFromInt(-5), result)
   452â†’}
   453â†’
   454â†’// Benchmark hot paths
   455â†’func BenchmarkCalcSR(b *testing.B) {
   456â†’    data := generatePriceData(1000)
   457â†’    b.ResetTimer()
   458â†’
   459â†’    for i := 0; i < b.N; i++ {
   460â†’        CalcSR(data)
   461â†’    }
   462â†’}
   463â†’```
   464â†’
   465â†’## Documentation Rules
   466â†’
   467â†’### Code Comments
   468â†’
   469â†’```go
   470â†’// Document WHY, not WHAT
   471â†’// BAD:
   472â†’// Increment counter by 1
   473â†’counter++
   474â†’
   475â†’// GOOD:
   476â†’// Retry count for exchange rate limiting
   477â†’counter++
   478â†’
   479â†’// Document edge cases
   480â†’// Returns -1 if no valid price found
   481â†’func FindPrice(prices []decimal.Decimal) decimal.Decimal {
   482â†’    // ...
   483â†’}
   484â†’
   485â†’// Document assumptions
   486â†’// Assumes prices are sorted in ascending order
   487â†’func BinarySearch(prices []decimal.Decimal, target decimal.Decimal) int {
   488â†’    // ...
   489â†’}
   490â†’```
   491â†’
   492â†’### Package Documentation
   493â†’
   494â†’```go
   495â†’// Package engine implements the core trading engine for Big Meanie.
   496â†’//
   497â†’// The engine coordinates between strategy signals, risk management,
   498â†’// and exchange execution. It runs continuously, processing signals
   499â†’// and managing positions according to configured strategies.
   500â†’//
   501â†’// Basic usage:
   502â†’//
   503â†’//	cfg := engine.DefaultConfig()
   504â†’//	eng := engine.New(cfg)
   505â†’//	err := eng.Run(ctx)
   506â†’//
   507â†’package engine
   508â†’```
   509â†’
   510â†’### README Files
   511â†’
   512â†’```markdown
   513â†’# Component Name
   514â†’
   515â†’## Purpose
   516â†’One paragraph explaining what this does and why it exists.
   517â†’
   518â†’## Usage
   519â†’Code examples showing common usage patterns.
   520â†’
   521â†’## Configuration
   522â†’Environment variables or config files needed.
   523â†’
   524â†’## Testing
   525â†’How to run tests for this component.
   526â†’
   527â†’Never create documentation unless explicitly requested.
   528â†’Document in code, not in separate files.
   529â†’```
   530â†’
   531â†’## Anti-Patterns to Avoid
   532â†’
   533â†’### Never Do These
   534â†’
   535â†’```go
   536â†’// 1. Backwards compatibility layers
   537â†’type Service struct {
   538â†’    v1Client *ClientV1
   539â†’    v2Client *ClientV2  // NEVER
   540â†’}
   541â†’
   542â†’// 2. Gradual migrations
   543â†’if useNewSystem {
   544â†’    processNew()
   545â†’} else {
   546â†’    processOld()  // NEVER
   547â†’}
   548â†’
   549â†’// 3. Deprecation warnings
   550â†’// Deprecated: Use NewMethod instead
   551â†’func OldMethod() {  // Just delete it
   552â†’}
   553â†’
   554â†’// 4. Feature flags for old behavior
   555â†’if featureFlag("use-old-algorithm") {  // NEVER
   556â†’    oldAlgorithm()
   557â†’}
   558â†’
   559â†’// 5. Compatibility shims
   560â†’func shimOldToNew(old Old) New {  // NEVER
   561â†’    // Convert old format to new
   562â†’}
   563â†’
   564â†’// 6. Variant files
   565â†’order_v2.go      // NEVER
   566â†’order_new.go     // NEVER
   567â†’order_temp.go    // NEVER
   568â†’
   569â†’// 7. TODO comments for compatibility
   570â†’// TODO: Remove after all clients updated  // NEVER
   571â†’```
   572â†’
   573â†’## Summary of Conventions
   574â†’
   575â†’1. **Concise naming** - SR not SupportResistance
   576â†’2. **No backwards compatibility** - Break it cleanly
   577â†’3. **No migration code** - Direct cutover only
   578â†’4. **No variant files** - Update the original
   579â†’5. **Fast failures** - Errors surface immediately
   580â†’6. **Single version** - No v1, v2 APIs
   581â†’7. **Clean breaks** - Force immediate fixes
   582â†’8. **Direct solutions** - No adapter patterns
   583â†’9. **Test everything** - Never skip tests
   584â†’10. **Document WHY** - Code explains what, comments explain why
   585â†’
   586â†’Remember: **Every line of compatibility code is technical debt.** Break fast, fix immediately, move forward.
   587â†’

1â†’# Big Meanie Architecture & Implementation Plan
     2â†’
     3â†’## Executive Summary
     4â†’
     5â†’This document consolidates the architectural and implementation plans for the Big Meanie trading system. It covers critical infrastructure components including the TimeSeries data management solution and the custom test package to replace testify. Both designs follow the project's core principles of minimal dependencies, no backwards compatibility, and clean Go idiomatic code.
     6â†’
     7â†’## 1. Core Infrastructure Components
     8â†’
     9â†’### 1.1 TimeSeries Architecture
    10â†’
    11â†’The indicators package requires a TimeSeries solution to manage OHLCV data for technical analysis. After analyzing requirements and existing code patterns, the recommendation is to build a **custom minimal TimeSeries package** that aligns with Go idioms and project principles.
    12â†’
    13â†’#### 1.1.a Requirements Analysis
    14â†’
    15â†’**Data Management Requirements:**
    16â†’- Store OHLCV candles (Open, High, Low, Close, Volume) with timestamps
    17â†’- Support both fixed-size windows (for live trading) and growing datasets (for backtesting)
    18â†’- Efficient access by index for indicator calculations
    19â†’- Thread-safe for concurrent indicator calculations
    20â†’
    21â†’**Interface Requirements (from indicators/interfaces.go):**
    22â†’```go
    23â†’type TimeSeries interface {
    24â†’    Symbol() string
    25â†’    Len() int
    26â†’    GetCandle(index int) *types.Candle
    27â†’    LastCandle() *types.Candle
    28â†’    LastIndex() int
    29â†’}
    30â†’```
    31â†’
    32â†’**Performance Requirements:**
    33â†’- Fast random access for indicator calculations
    34â†’- Minimal memory allocations during updates
    35â†’- Support datasets of 100K+ candles for backtesting
    36â†’- Sub-millisecond updates for live trading
    37â†’
    38â†’**Usage Patterns Observed:**
    39â†’- Sequential access patterns during precalculation
    40â†’- Random access for lookback periods
    41â†’- Cache-friendly iteration over ranges
    42â†’- Read-heavy workload (write once, read many)
    43â†’
    44â†’#### 1.1.b Design Decisions
    45â†’
    46â†’**Build vs Buy Analysis:**
    47â†’
    48â†’Existing Go TimeSeries libraries were evaluated:
    49â†’1. **github.com/influxdata/influxdb/pkg/tsdb** - Heavy dependency, overkill
    50â†’2. **github.com/VividCortex/gohistogram** - Histogram-focused, not OHLCV
    51â†’3. **github.com/go-kit/kit/metrics** - Metrics-focused, wrong abstraction
    52â†’
    53â†’**Decision: Build Custom Solution**
    54â†’- âœ… Zero external dependencies
    55â†’- âœ… Tailored to exact needs
    56â†’- âœ… Follows project principles
    57â†’- âœ… Simple, maintainable code (~300 LOC)
    58â†’
    59â†’**Architecture Decisions:**
    60â†’
    61â†’1. **Two Implementation Strategy:**
    62â†’   - `FixedWindow`: For live trading (sliding window, bounded memory)
    63â†’   - `Growing`: For backtesting (append-only, unbounded)
    64â†’   - Common interface allows indicators to work with both
    65â†’
    66â†’2. **Value Semantics for Candles:**
    67â†’   - Store by value in slices for cache locality
    68â†’   - Return pointers to avoid copying large structs
    69â†’
    70â†’3. **Sync.RWMutex for Thread Safety:**
    71â†’   - Read-heavy workload benefits from RWMutex
    72â†’   - Allows multiple concurrent indicator calculations
    73â†’
    74â†’4. **Pre-allocation Strategy:**
    75â†’   - Growing: Start with capacity hint
    76â†’   - FixedWindow: Allocate full size upfront
    77â†’
    78â†’#### 1.1.c Package Design
    79â†’
    80â†’**Package Structure:**
    81â†’```
    82â†’pkg/ts/
    83â†’â”œâ”€â”€ ts.go           # Interfaces and types
    84â†’â”œâ”€â”€ fixed.go        # Fixed-size window implementation
    85â†’â”œâ”€â”€ growing.go      # Growing series implementation
    86â†’â”œâ”€â”€ candle.go       # Candle type and methods
    87â†’â””â”€â”€ ts_test.go      # Comprehensive tests
    88â†’```
    89â†’
    90â†’**Core Types:**
    91â†’```go
    92â†’// Candle represents OHLCV data point
    93â†’type Candle struct {
    94â†’    Symbol    string
    95â†’    Timestamp time.Time
    96â†’    Open      decimal.Decimal
    97â†’    High      decimal.Decimal
    98â†’    Low       decimal.Decimal
    99â†’    Close     decimal.Decimal
   100â†’    Volume    decimal.Decimal
   101â†’}
   102â†’
   103â†’// Series interface for all TimeSeries implementations
   104â†’type Series interface {
   105â†’    Symbol() string
   106â†’    Len() int
   107â†’    GetCandle(index int) *Candle
   108â†’    LastCandle() *Candle
   109â†’    LastIndex() int
   110â†’    Add(candle Candle)
   111â†’    Clear()
   112â†’}
   113â†’```
   114â†’
   115â†’#### 1.1.d Implementation Details
   116â†’
   117â†’**Fixed Window Implementation:**
   118â†’- Circular buffer for memory efficiency
   119â†’- Logical to physical index mapping
   120â†’- Thread-safe with RWMutex
   121â†’- Pre-allocated array of fixed size
   122â†’
   123â†’**Growing Implementation:**
   124â†’- Append-only slice with capacity hints
   125â†’- Direct index access
   126â†’- Thread-safe with RWMutex
   127â†’- Dynamic growth as needed
   128â†’
   129â†’#### 1.1.e Integration Strategy
   130â†’
   131â†’1. **Create types package first** with Candle type alias
   132â†’2. **Update indicator interfaces** to use new types
   133â†’3. **Both ts.Fixed and ts.Growing** satisfy the interface
   134â†’
   135â†’**Usage Examples:**
   136â†’
   137â†’Backtesting:
   138â†’```go
   139â†’series := ts.NewGrowing("BTC/USD", 10000)
   140â†’for _, candle := range historicalData {
   141â†’    series.Add(candle)
   142â†’}
   143â†’rsi := indicators.NewRSI(series, 14)
   144â†’```
   145â†’
   146â†’Live Trading:
   147â†’```go
   148â†’series := ts.NewFixed("BTC/USD", 500)
   149â†’for candle := range candleStream {
   150â†’    series.Add(candle)
   151â†’}
   152â†’```
   153â†’
   154â†’#### 1.1.f Performance Optimizations
   155â†’
   156â†’**Memory Layout:**
   157â†’- Store Candles by value for cache locality
   158â†’- Align struct fields for optimal padding
   159â†’- Pre-allocate slices to avoid growths
   160â†’
   161â†’**Concurrency:**
   162â†’- RWMutex allows multiple readers
   163â†’- Lock-free reads where possible
   164â†’- Consider atomic operations for metadata
   165â†’
   166â†’**Future Optimizations:**
   167â†’- Memory pool for Candle allocations
   168â†’- SIMD operations for bulk calculations
   169â†’- Custom iterator for cache-friendly traversal
   170â†’
   171â†’### 1.2 Test Package Design
   172â†’
   173â†’Replace testify dependency which brings yaml.v3 as an indirect dependency, creating technical debt and potential security vulnerabilities.
   174â†’
   175â†’#### 1.2.a Problem Analysis
   176â†’
   177â†’**Current Issue:**
   178â†’- testify v1.8.4 brings in `gopkg.in/yaml.v3` as indirect dependency
   179â†’- yaml.v3 is outdated/deprecated (2 versions behind)
   180â†’- Violates principle of minimal dependencies
   181â†’
   182â†’**Usage Analysis:**
   183â†’- 21 test files using testify
   184â†’- Only using `assert` and `require` packages
   185â†’- Most used: Equal (47), NoError (32), NotNil (18), Nil (12)
   186â†’
   187â†’#### 1.2.b Solution Design
   188â†’
   189â†’**Recommendation: Custom Test Package**
   190â†’
   191â†’Create minimal `pkg/test/` package with zero external dependencies.
   192â†’
   193â†’**Pros:**
   194â†’- Zero external dependencies
   195â†’- Concise naming aligned with project standards
   196â†’- Tailored to actual usage
   197â†’- Can add decimal-specific assertions later
   198â†’- Full control over implementation
   199â†’
   200â†’**Package Structure:**
   201â†’```
   202â†’pkg/test/
   203â†’â”œâ”€â”€ assert.go      # Non-fatal assertions
   204â†’â”œâ”€â”€ require.go     # Fatal assertions  
   205â†’â”œâ”€â”€ test_test.go   # Tests for the test package
   206â†’â””â”€â”€ README.md      # Documentation
   207â†’```
   208â†’
   209â†’#### 1.2.c API Design
   210â†’
   211â†’**Core Assertions:**
   212â†’```go
   213â†’// Comparison
   214â†’func Equal[T comparable](t *testing.T, expected, actual T, msgs ...string)
   215â†’func NotEqual[T comparable](t *testing.T, expected, actual T, msgs ...string)
   216â†’
   217â†’// Nil checks
   218â†’func Nil(t *testing.T, v any, msgs ...string)
   219â†’func NotNil(t *testing.T, v any, msgs ...string)
   220â†’
   221â†’// Boolean
   222â†’func True(t *testing.T, v bool, msgs ...string)
   223â†’func False(t *testing.T, v bool, msgs ...string)
   224â†’
   225â†’// Collections
   226â†’func Empty(t *testing.T, v any, msgs ...string)
   227â†’func NotEmpty(t *testing.T, v any, msgs ...string)
   228â†’func Contains(t *testing.T, container, item any, msgs ...string)
   229â†’func Len(t *testing.T, v any, expected int, msgs ...string)
   230â†’
   231â†’// Errors
   232â†’func Error(t *testing.T, err error, msgs ...string)
   233â†’func NoError(t *testing.T, err error, msgs ...string)
   234â†’
   235â†’// Numeric
   236â†’func Greater[T Ordered](t *testing.T, actual, expected T, msgs ...string)
   237â†’func InDelta(t *testing.T, expected, actual, delta float64, msgs ...string)
   238â†’```
   239â†’
   240â†’**Fatal Assertions (require.go):**
   241â†’```go
   242â†’func RequireEqual[T comparable](t *testing.T, expected, actual T, msgs ...string)
   243â†’func RequireNoError(t *testing.T, err error, msgs ...string)
   244â†’func RequireNotNil(t *testing.T, v any, msgs ...string)
   245â†’```
   246â†’
   247â†’#### 1.2.d Migration Strategy
   248â†’
   249â†’**Phase 1: Create Testing Package**
   250â†’1. Create `pkg/test/` directory
   251â†’2. Implement core assertion functions
   252â†’3. Write comprehensive tests
   253â†’4. Ensure 100% compatibility with existing patterns
   254â†’
   255â†’**Phase 2: Automated Migration**
   256â†’1. Replace imports via script
   257â†’2. Replace function calls using sed/awk
   258â†’3. Map all testify functions to new equivalents
   259â†’
   260â†’**Phase 3: Verification**
   261â†’1. Run all tests to ensure they pass
   262â†’2. Remove testify from go.mod
   263â†’3. Verify yaml.v3 is removed
   264â†’
   265â†’## 2. Implementation Roadmap
   266â†’
   267â†’### 2.1 TimeSeries Implementation
   268â†’
   269â†’#### 2.1.a Phase 1: Core Implementation (2-3 hours)
   270â†’- [ ] Create pkg/ts package structure
   271â†’- [ ] Implement Candle type
   272â†’- [ ] Implement Fixed window
   273â†’- [ ] Implement Growing series
   274â†’- [ ] Write comprehensive tests
   275â†’
   276â†’#### 2.1.b Phase 2: Integration (1-2 hours)
   277â†’- [ ] Create pkg/types with Candle alias
   278â†’- [ ] Update indicator interfaces
   279â†’- [ ] Test with existing indicators
   280â†’- [ ] Fix any integration issues
   281â†’
   282â†’#### 2.1.c Phase 3: Optimization (Optional)
   283â†’- [ ] Profile with real data
   284â†’- [ ] Optimize hot paths
   285â†’- [ ] Add specialized methods if needed
   286â†’
   287â†’### 2.2 Test Package Implementation
   288â†’
   289â†’#### 2.2.a Implementation Checklist
   290â†’- [ ] Create pkg/test directory structure
   291â†’- [ ] Implement Equal, NotEqual, Nil, NotNil functions
   292â†’- [ ] Implement True, False boolean functions
   293â†’- [ ] Implement Error, NoError error functions
   294â†’- [ ] Implement Empty, NotEmpty, Len collection functions
   295â†’- [ ] Implement Contains, NotContains functions
   296â†’- [ ] Implement Greater, GreaterEqual, Less, LessEqual comparison functions
   297â†’- [ ] Implement InDelta for float comparisons
   298â†’- [ ] Implement Zero function
   299â†’- [ ] Implement Require versions (RequireNoError, RequireNotNil, RequireEqual)
   300â†’- [ ] Write comprehensive tests for test package
   301â†’- [ ] Create migration script
   302â†’- [ ] Migrate existing test files
   303â†’- [ ] Remove testify from go.mod
   304â†’- [ ] Verify yaml.v3 is removed
   305â†’- [ ] Update documentation
   306â†’
   307â†’## 3. Testing Strategy
   308â†’
   309â†’### 3.1 TimeSeries Testing
   310â†’
   311â†’**Unit Tests:**
   312â†’- Test both Fixed and Growing implementations
   313â†’- Concurrent access tests
   314â†’- Boundary conditions (empty, single, full)
   315â†’- Circular buffer correctness for Fixed
   316â†’
   317â†’**Benchmarks:**
   318â†’```go
   319â†’func BenchmarkFixedAdd(b *testing.B)
   320â†’func BenchmarkFixedGet(b *testing.B)
   321â†’func BenchmarkGrowingAdd(b *testing.B)
   322â†’func BenchmarkGrowingGet(b *testing.B)
   323â†’func BenchmarkConcurrentReads(b *testing.B)
   324â†’```
